中文名稱  Course Title ：專題演講
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Colloquium
任課教師  Instructor ：吳劍侯
上課時間  Time ： W7W8 上課教室  Room ：醫環 301 ／ 92
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The departmental colloquium is a research talk that is supposed to be accessible
to everyone who does research in BMES department, i.e. it will assume that you
have familiarity with all the basic ideas of the field that everyone in the
department ought to know, but not a specialized knowledge of the subfield that
the talk is about. It ought to be pitched at the level of a beginning graduate
student.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
No textbook assigned.
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Listening and Discussion
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1.不分領域，本學期每⼈⾄少參加 10 次演講。
2.每學期每⼈⾄少發問 1 次  ( 全勤者可抵免；演講後附上問題交回助教登記 )
3.演講前、後均需簽到  ( 只簽到沒簽退者，倒扣⼀次 ) ，代簽者以不及格論處。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
A one-semester course teaching graduate students how to deliver an oral
presentation. Students will be required to give presentation and host a
discussion session. The topics are limited to the areas of students'
specialties.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
No textbook assigned.
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Mostly group discussion in class.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Lectures will be given only in two classes for guiding the
fundamentals of presentation. Students will be assigned
topics to give a presentation in one semester.
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Discussion participation (30%)
Presentation (70%)

This course is designed for those students who have interest in environemntal
science and technology. Several fundamental courses including physical
chemistry, analytical chemistry and/or organic chemistry are needed.

Francis Group.

and Company.

科號  10910AES520400 學分  3 ⼈數限制

科⽬中文名稱  ⽣態與健康
科⽬英文名稱  Ecohealth
任課教師  楊樹森  周秀專
⼀、課程說明  本課程⽣態與健康 (ECOHEALTH) 以⽣態系與⼈類健康的關聯分析為前導，透過
⽔、空
氣、⼟壤及食物鏈因素將⽣態系服務當作維持⼈類⽣活健康重⼤因素，由此分析當代環境品質下降
之後造
成的健康損失。健康的損失除了個⼈⽣理影響之外，進⽽影像社群、社區及社會，反饋之後造成更
進⼀步
的⼼理性健康損失。研究這類影響是⼀⾨相當新穎主體，本課程除了前端的關聯性探討之外，也設
法就⽣
態健康的研究法提供各種可能⽅法及流程。
⼆、指定⽤書  Crescentia Y. Dakubo, 2010, Ecosystems and Human Health
A Critical Approach to Ecohealth Researchand Practice, Springer is part of
Springer
Science+Business Media (www.springer.com)

科號  Course Number ：
11110ANTH674200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：台灣史前文化
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Prehistoric culture of Taiwan
任課教師  Instructor ：邱鴻霖
上課時間  Time ： R2R3R4 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C303 ／ 10
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程名稱：『台灣史前文化』
授課教師：邱鴻霖
學 分  數： 3
時間地點：依系統表訂時間地點，若有變更會於第⼀堂課中說明
⼀、  課程主旨
有文字記載的「台灣歷史」僅約四百年，最新資料顯⽰⾃兩萬年前台灣有⼈類活動以來，台灣
的史前史占了台灣⼈類發展史的 98% 以上，但是⼤部分的「史前史」在國⾼中基礎教育與⼤學通識課
程中皆鮮少著墨。本課程的主要⽬的不僅在介紹與引導碩⼠班研究⽣認識台灣史前文化的基本架構與
內涵；更希望以議題式的討論⽅式，將台灣各地史前文化在區域歷史建構上的意義與研究上的問題突
顯出來。例如，當代原住⺠族群的歷史建構只停留在⽇據時期的時間點上，其與史前文化的關聯性應
當如何看待？台灣史前文化從物質文化、⽣態適應、社會習俗等觀點上如何構連起「時間與空間」的
「連續與斷裂」？皆是本課程中所側重的討論重點。
⼆、  課程內容
1. 課程說明  ( 第 1 週 )
課程理念與⽬標介紹
參考資料介紹
2. 認識台灣史前文化  ( 第 2~3 週 )
台灣史前文化的架構與定位：建構考古文化、區域史的定位、島內史的框架
台灣史前文化研究發展史：重要學者與論述與⽅法學的轉變
史前文化與歷史時期的聯繫：舊社考古與平埔研究
3. 台灣史前文化與當代社會  ( 第 4 週 )
史前文化的研究與教育：研究者、教育體系與⾏政機構
文化資產與倫理學：倫理規範、文化資產的所有權、法令
4. 台灣史前史概說  ( 第 5-6 週 )
台灣考古學發展史
台灣史前史的時空架構
5. 校外教學  ( 第 7 週 )
實地⾛訪遺址與博物館
6. 講演  (第 8 週 )
台灣考古研究專家演講與互動討論
7. 台灣北部地區的史前文化  ( 第 9-10 週 )
⼤坌坑文化、繩紋紅陶文化、圓⼭文化、植物園文化、⼗三⾏文化
8. 台灣中部與⼭地的史前文化  ( 第 11-12 週 )
⼤坌坑文化、⽜罵頭文化、⼤⾺璘文化、番⼦園文化

澎湖、⾦⾨、⾺祖、綠島、蘭嶼
12. 期末茶會與期末報告  ( 第 18 週 )
三、  課程⽅式與相關活動
教學⽅式主要分為四種⽅式實施：
〈第⼀〉由教師講授主題⼤綱與重點引導，以教師製作之講義、投影片輔助教學。
〈第⼆〉第三堂課由學⽣預先選讀文章報告，以討論會⽅式進⾏，由教師引導。
〈第三〉演講或實地前往遺址、博物館⾒習。
〈第四〉期末報告以台灣史前文化為資料背景，提出議題式討論報告 (5000 字左右 )

科號  Course Number ：
11110ASTR530000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：星系天文學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Galactic Astronomy
任課教師  Instructor ：安德魯 ˙ 古柏
上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 501 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明  (Course Description)
This course is a graduate-level introduction to theories and observations of
galaxy formation and evolution, in the concordance Dark Energy and Cold Dark
Matter (LambdaCDM) model.
The course is intended as a primer for graduate research. We will aim to cover a
broad range of topics, rather than a rigorous mathematical treatment.
PLEASE NOTE: The level will be suitable for graduate and senior undergraduate
students whose major is Physics or Astrophysics. The course will assume an
undergraduate background knowledge of astronomy. Self-guided study and in-class
discussion will be an important component of the course.
The course will be offered and assessed in English.
The homework exercises will involve simple numerical equation-solving and graph-
plotting tasks. Basic instruction in python will be provided in the first two
lectures.
Course website: http://www.phys.nthu.edu.tw/~acooper/teaching//galaxy/
教學進度 (Syllabus)
The minimum syllabus is:
1. Astronomical measurements and observational techniques
2. Stars and stellar populations
3. Morphology, surface photometry and key statistics
4. The cosmological context of galaxy formation
5. Dark matter halo origins and structure
6. The origin of galaxies, gas cooling
7. Cold gas disks and star formation
8. Feedback and chemical enrichment
9. Gravitational dynamics
10. Galaxy interactions and mergers
11. Galaxy evolution over cosmic time
12. Galaxy clusters and AGN
13. The Milky Way and the Local Group
Extra material will be included where time permits.
教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures, reading assignments.
成績考核  (Evaluation)
Midterm reading assignment (report and presentation), midterm and final quiz,
approximately 4 homework exercises.
指定⽤書  (Text Books)
The course will not follow any one textbook, but the following will be useful for
reference. links to review articles etc. will be given in class.
* “Galaxy Formation” (2nd Ed.) by M. Longair (2007, Springer)
* Fundamentals of Galaxy Dynamics, Formation and Evolution by Ignacio Ferreras
(2019, UCL Press). Free e-book: https://www.uclpress.co.uk/products/84078
* “Galaxy Formation and Evolution” by H. Mo, S. White & F. van den Bosch
(2010, Cambridge University Press)
* “Galactic Astronomy” (2nd ed.) by J. Binney & M. Merrifield (2008, Princeton
University Press)
* “An Introduction to Modern Astrophysics” (2nd ed.) by B. W. Carroll & D. A.
Ostlie (2006, Pearson Addison-Wesley)
* “Introduction to Cosmology” (2nd Ed.) by Barbara Ryden (2016, Cambridge
University Press)
* “An Introduction to Modern Cosmology” (3rd Ed.) by Andrew Liddle (2015, Wiley)
* “Observational Cosmology” by S. Serjeant (2010, Cambridge University Press)
* “Cosmological Physics” by J.A. Peacock (1999, Cambridge University Press)
科號  Course Number ：
11110ASTR591000學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：專題演講⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Colloquium (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：何英宏
上課時間  Time ： F6F7 上課教室  Room ：物  124 ／ 137
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
Giving and listening to presentations, doing literature search, asking
constructive questions, and interacting with colleagues who work on different
topics and in different institutes are all essential professional skills not
only for doing astronomical research but also for careers in many other
disciplines. The weekly colloquia are excellent opportunities for practicing
these skills. For example, thinking about how others give presentations will
help you improve your own. Previewing relevant publications, even just
briefly, will improve understanding of the presentation and inspire deeper
questions. Interacting with visiting speakers will help you learn not only
about science, but also about different perspectives on life and work in the
world of professional astronomy.
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
Grades of this course will be evaluated based on:
1. Attendance (75%): Please sign in using the sign-up sheet provided by the TA
for each colloquium. Students who attend all regular colloquia on Fridays will
receive full credits in this category. Attendance of the special seminars will
not be counted.
2. Participation (25%): Students are encouraged to interact with the speakers
and reflect on the colloquium. To receive the participation points, please
submit a short report to the TA within one week after the colloquium. Reports
on special seminars will be counted too.
● 可連結之網⾴位址  相關網⾴ (Website)
1. The colloquium schedule can be found on the IoA website:
http://astr.web.nthu.edu.tw
2. Course-related materials (e.g., report template) can be found on the google
classroom that will be sent out.
科號  Course Number ：
11110ASTR600700學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：天文物理的前沿⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Frontier of Astrophysics Seminars (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：後藤友嗣
上課時間  Time ： TnWnRn 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 501 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
-課程說明  (Course Description)
It is an important task for all researches to keep up with the latest
publications in the field. However, just in astronomy, nearly 40 new
papers are published every day. It is significant amount of work to
keep up with a flood of papers. The purpose of this course is to train
students how to read and understand the essence of new research papers
in a limited amount of time. Students will take no more than one hour
to read a paper of their choice, and take turn to present a short
summary in 10min. A focus is to understand the essence, and not to
understand details. It is not required to read all the details of
paper. At the same time, other students in the class have a good
chance to learn about latest papers, while listening to the speaker.
The instructor will teach a relevant physics/concept to the reviewed
paper after the presentation.
The course is on every Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday from 12:20pm to 13:10pm.
In one session, two papers will be reviewed. Therefore, in one
semester, we will review almost 100 papers.
By the end of the semester, students will be familiar with the latest
progress in astronomy.
Previous knowledge is not required. We would rather learn key concepts
of astronomy, as we come across in research papers. This is a more
practical and realistic way happening in every day research life.
This course will be offered in English.
-參考書籍  (References)
Papers to be presented are selected from the following archive servers.
http://nthu.voxcharta.org/
http://arxiv.org/list/astro-ph/new
-教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Presentations by students followed by a review by the instructor.
-成績考核 (Evaluation)
Attendance, questions, and presentations.
科號  Course Number ：
11110ASTR610000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 15
中文名稱  Course Title ：天文觀測
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Observational Astronomy
任課教師  Instructor ：江國興
上課時間  Time ： W6W7W8 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 521 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Description:
Please note that this course is a graduate course and you are expected to have basic skills of astronomical
observations with research grade telescopes. If you did not attend "Fundamentals of Observational
Astronomy ( 基礎天文觀測 )" (PHYS391 or PHYS392) before, you may be required to have an interview
before
admitting to this course.
The course will be conducted in English.
Overview:
An introduction to modern observational techniques of astronomy. The course will cover astronomical
observations across the electromagnetic spectrum, an introduction to gravitational wave and neutrino
observatories, and statistical analysis of astronomical data.
A visit (2 nights) to the Lulin Observatory will be arranged on Oct 28-29, and all the students are expected
to use the 1m telescope to carry out a small research project.
Teaching Method:
1. Lectures and tutorials
2. Demonstrations
3. Lab exercises
Syllabus:
Telescopes, CCD detectors, photometry, spectroscopy, interferometry, observational techniques of X-ray
astronomy, observation planning and review, data analysis, and model fitting
Evaluation:
Homeworks, observation exercises, projects, mid-term, and final examination
References:
1. Astronomy Methods by H. Bradt
2. Practical Statistics for Astronomers by J.V. Wall & C.R. Jenkins
3. Data Reduction and Error Analysis for the Physical Sciences by P.R. Bevington & D.K. Robinson
科號  Course Number ：
11110ASTR660000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：計算天文物理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Computational Astrophysics
任課教師  Instructor ：楊湘怡
上課時間  Time ： R6R7R8 上課教室  Room ：物  501 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Computational Astrophysics -- Syllabus
This is one of the graduate-level courses offered by the Institute of Astronomy of NTHU. The aim of this
course is to provide students with the essential knowledge and skills in computation that will be useful for
both theoretical and observational astrophysicists. How the numerical methods are applied to frontier
astrophysical research topics will be emphasized. The lectures will be conducted in English.
Computation is best learnt through practice, so programming will be an important ingredient in homework
assignments as well as the final project. Therefore, some experience with at least one programming language
(e.g., C, Fortran, Python) is strongly encouraged. Experience with a Unix-like system (e.g., Linux, Mac OS X,
or Windows 10 subsystem for Linux) is required.
The grades would be evaluated as follows:
Homework (40%)
A term project (60%)
Term project:
The term project is meant for the students to apply the knowledge or numerical techniques learned in this
class to their research projects or a topic of their interest. The project could be related to one of the
following:
1. Design a new numerical technique (tool/library/application)
2. Tackle an astrophysical problem that involve numerical techniques covered in class
3. Reproduce scientific numerical results in published journals
The grades for the term project will include a midterm oral presentation on the project proposal (20%), a final
oral presentation on the project results (30%), and the final product of the project (10%).
Tentative topics of the class include:
-- Overview of the course, programming basics and tools
-- Introduction to numerical analyses (stability, convergence, errors)
-- Numerical linear algebra
-- Solving non-linear equations
-- ODEs: initial value problems, boundary value problems
-- PDEs: hyperbolic equations, elliptic equations
-- N-body simulations
-- Hydrodynamic simulations of astrophysical fluids
-- Parallel programming
The references include:
1. "Numerical Recipe" by Press, W. H. (http://www.nr.com)
2. "Numerical Methods in Astrophysics" by Bodenheimer, P. et al.
3. "Scientific Computing: An Introductory Survey" by Michael Heath
4. "Introduction to Computational Astrophysical Hydrodynamics" by Zingale, M. (https://github.com/python-
hydro/hydro_examples)

Teachers: 楊立威、張筱涵、羅中泉老師  (Profs LW Yang, HH Chang, CC Lo)
Textbooks:
1. Michael C. Whitlock and Dolph Schluter. 2014. The Analysis of Biological
Data (Second Edition). Roberts and Company Publishers, Greenwood Village,

Date Topic Instructor
9/13 From the things you already knew (to some extent) – mean, SD,
variance, how is statistics related to probability? Hypothesis testing. Why does
statistics/probability constitute the basics of machine learning (examples on drug
development etc)? LW Yang
9/20 Read the math formula – index, difference between probability
(discrete function) and probability density (continuous function), Comparing two
means (doing it with your MS Excel sheet), learning from playing dynamics
programming games to align two biological sequences LW Yang
9/27 Distributions Rules Probability addition/multiplication, dependency,
conditional probability, marginal probability and Bayes' theorem LW Yang
10/4 Python quiz (5%), math quiz (5%) TA/LWYang
10/11 Build your first probabilistic model - a classifier, (Relative) Entropy,
Information Content, “Distance” between Distributions, Boltzmann Relation LW
Yang
10/18 Normalization – frequency vs proportion, normalization by controls, by
ranking, by probability LW Yang
10/25 Data types, sampling biases and rules, inference from samples I HH Chang
11/1 Inference from samples II HH Chang
11/8 Analyzing categorical data: goodness-of-fit test, contingency analysis HH
Chang
11/15 Correlation and Regression I HH Chang
11/22 Correlation and Regression II HH Chang
11/29 Models of neurons and synapses CC Lo
12/06 Models of synaptic plasticity and memory CC Lo
12/13 Matrix and linear algebra CC Lo
12/20 Stability and dynamical system theory CC Lo
12/27 Learning and decision making in biological neural networks CC Lo

Yang: two computational homework (15% each – Protein Sequence Aligner & CpG island
predictor using log-odd values), one math exam and one python exam (10%)
Chang: homework (30%)
Lo: homework (30%)

Python programming taught in 10 weeks + one session of basic Linux

● 課程說明 (Course Description)
BAI Colloquium is a forum for conversation centralized in biomedical artificial
intelligence and its relevant data-driven and first-principle-based
methodologies.
Scholars and key opinion leader (KOL) from industry will be invited to give a
talk, followed by Q&A.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
N/A
● 參考書籍 (References)
Slides; recorded media; journal papers
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Slides;
Media;
On-site/virtual discussion
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
Invited speakers:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/10C2VskwV_l4x9k5TZe0THv2NLrZxNIkjcxYb08Jp2w
c/edit#gid=0
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
Students' final grade is composed of:
(a) A Mid-term report where students submit a report with critiques on research
integrity issues (written in English). Several such lectures can be found online
within which we recommend (prioritized for the first year PhD student) –
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fwyWrOXWM2M (in Chinese) or
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tavhmyd3XHE (in English).
Students have to listen to at least one of these lectures to write a report no
more than one A4 page (30%); and
(b) A final report with the learning and critiques to one of the BAI lectures in
the semesters. In-text citation and references must be included in the 2-page
report (70%).
No plagiarism policy - Given clear evidence that part or all of the report is
copied from other students and/or resources online, the student who plagiarizes
fails the class.

半的老師均會做的教導，還是該教授的特殊偏好與⾏為。

500800學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 24
中文名稱  Course Title ：癌症⽣物學與治療
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Cancer Biology and Therapy
任課教師  Instructor ：陳韻晶
上課時間  Time ： M5M6M7 上課教室  Room ：清實 826 ／ 24
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀. 課程⽬標 (Course objective)
1. Develop basic concepts of Cancer Biology
2. Learn to integrate and apply various concepts to Cancer Therapy
⼆. 課程說明 (Course Description)
The impact of cancer on human health is immense, driving force to accelerate
research effort
on
understanding of the basic biology of cancer, leading to more effective treatment
strategies
and more
sensitive and accurate diagnosis tools. This course will provide a comprehensive
coverage of
virtually all
areas of cancer research, emphasizing the cellular and molecular basis of cancer
and
development of
therapeutic strategy. The first half of the course will discuss the genetic and
molecular basis
of cancer. We
will explore the regulation of cell cycle, cell death, cell signaling and
metabolism in cancer.
The second
half
of the course will focus on the tumor microenvironment and therapy strategy. We
will shift our
attention to
the surrounding stromal cells instead of cancer cells. Every lecture will include
a discussion of
the rational
treatment of cancer. In the final section, we will explore the development of
novel therapeutic
strategies for
cancer.
⼆、指定⽤書或參考書籍 (Text Books and References)
The Biology of Cancer, 2nd edition, 2013; Garland Science; Robert A. Weinberg.
三、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Exam (mid-term and final) 60%
Writing assignment 20%
Group performance 10%
Attendance 10%
四、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction of Cancer Biology and Therapy
2. Cell cycle and Cancer
3. Senescence and Cancer
4. Cell death and Cancer
5. Apoptosis, Autophagy and Cancer
6. Cell signaling and Cancer
7. Midterm
8. metabolism and Cancer
9. Angiogenesis and Cancer
10. metastasis I
11. metastasis II
13. Cancer immunity
14. Cancer Diagnosis and Treatment
15. Cancer Nanotech
16. Final Exam
五. 講師  (Instructor)
Dr. Yunching Chen
http://mx.nthu.edu.tw/~yunching/drug_targeting_lab/PI.html
課程內容  ：
涵蓋癌症⽣物學機制 , 由細胞分裂 , 複製 , 凋亡談起 ,
延伸⾄癌細胞代謝和⾎管新⽣ , 癌轉移和免疫脫逃 …… 等 .
每⼀單元根據其相關機制探討和設計相應的治療策略 ,
在治療端的探討包含⼩分⼦藥物 , ⼤分⼦蛋⽩藥 , 基因治療 ,
免疫治療 , 利⽤藥物輸送系統克服癌症治療上的困難 …… 等 .
授課⽅式：
本課程為研究所課程 , 上課⽅式合併⼀般講課  (75%) 和課堂⼩組討論  (25%),
每⼀單元皆設計 3~4 個開放性討論問題 ,
培養同學獨立思考和研究能⼒ , 教師亦參與討論並給予回饋 .
評分⽅式：
包含⼀次期末⼩組⼝頭報告以及兩次筆試 .
筆試內容 80% 來⾃公開題⽬

503600學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：奈米光學材料
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Optical Nanomaterials
任課教師  Instructor ：萬德輝
上課時間  Time ： R6R7R8 上課教室  Room ：清實 826 ／ 24
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is divided into 2 semesters, including the basic optics (I) and surface plasmonics (II) of inorganic
materials. Semester One introduces fundamental optics of inorganic materials with an emphasis on the
underlying mechanisms that make optical materials what they are and that determine how they behave. Topics
include Wave propagation, Optical properties of conductors, and Optical properties of insulators-fundamentals
and applications.
本⾨課將分為上下學期教授，涵蓋無機材料的基礎光學性質 ( 上學期 ) 以及表⾯電漿 ( 下學期 ) ，並著重介
紹無機材料在⽣醫⼯程及奈米光電之應⽤。在上學期的課程中，將以良好光學基礎為主軸，引導學⽣
從邏輯思考進⽽瞭解材料光學原理，同時增強學⽣應有的實驗理論，包含基礎電磁波理論、⾦屬材料
之光學性質、非⾦屬材料之光學性質，並進⾏其在國際間尖端應⽤之介紹。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Lecture notes
三、參考書籍 (References)
D. J. Simmons and K. Potter, "Optical materials", 2000, Elesvier.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Powerpoint presentation
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1.Wave Propagation
2.Optical Properties of Conductors
3.Optical Properties of Insulators—Fundamentals
4.Optical Properties of Insulators—Applications
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Final exam: 50%
Project report: 50%

由於教室空間不⾜，上課地點將暫時更換為⼯程⼀館 217 教室
本課程內容包含細胞⽣物學、⽣物化學與分⼦⽣物學，旨在提供⼯程背景學⽣基礎⽣命科學知識，歡
迎非⽣科背景
同學選修。
This course aims to introduce the fundamentals of cellular and molecular biology to the students with an
engineering background. The purpose of the course is to provide students with a comprehensive and concise
overview of biological science with emphases on its relationship with biomedical engineering, such as tissue
engineering, drug/gene delivery and molecular imaging.
Textbook:
1. Waite GN et al., Applied Cell and Molecular Biology for Engineers, McGraw-Hill, New York, 2007
2. Lodish H et al., Molecular Cell Biology, 7th ed., W. H. Freeman, New York, 2012.
Course content:
1. Biochemistry (4 weeks)
2. Cell biology (7 weeks)
3. Molecular biology (4 weeks)
Evaluation:
30% Midterm Exam
30% Final Exam
20% Oral Presentation
10% Oral Presentation (raise questions)
10% Class Participation
科號  Course Number ： 11110BME
504000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⾦屬⽣物醫藥與⽣醫材料
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Metal-based biomedicine and biomaterials
任課教師  Instructor ：魯才德
上課時間  Time ： M2M3M4 上課教室  Room ：清實 826 ／ 24
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
本⾨課程旨在介紹 (1) ⾦屬⽣物醫藥的設計、合成以及功能、 (2) ⾦屬酵素的合成以及作⽤機制
以
及(3)⾦屬⾦醫材料的設計與開發。於學期末則安排由學⽣挑選相關主題，進⾏⼝頭報告。
This class aims to introduce (1) functional design and synthesis of metal-
based biomedicine, (2) synthesis, function, and reaction mechanism of
metalloenzymes, and the functional design and synthesis of metal-
based
biomaterials. In the end of the semester, students have to choose a topic and
give an oral presentation relevant to the application of metal chemistry in
biomedical engineering.
⼆、指定⽤書
上課講義
三、參考書籍
1. Principles of Bioinorganic Chemistry.
Stephen J. Lippard, Jeremy M. Berg.
ISBN: 0935702725
2. Biological Inorganic Chemistry
Ivano Bertini, Harry B. Gray, Edward I. Stiefel, Joan S. Valentine
ISBN:1891389432
四、教學⽅式
(1) 講授  Lecture
(2) ⼝頭報告  Oral presentation
(3) 課堂討論
五、教學進度
Week 1
課程簡介  Introduction
Week 2
基礎⽣物分⼦回顧與介紹  Review of biomolecules
Week 3
基礎化學與無機化學回顧與介紹  Review basic and inorganic chemistry
Week 4
鈉、鉀、鈣、鎂離⼦在⽣物體中的功能
Function of Na, K, Ca, and Mg ions in biological system
Week 5
國定假⽇  National Holiday
Week 6
含鐵⾦屬酵素的發現、結構、功能
Discovery, structure, and function of Fe-containing metalloenzyme
Week 7
含銅、鋅⾦屬酵素的發現、結構、功能
Discovery, structure, and function of Cu/Zn-containing metalloenzyme
Week 8
含其他⾦屬酵素的發現、結構、功能
Discovery, structure, and function of other metalloenzyme
Week 9
具⽣醫應⽤的⾦屬錯合物： cis-platin 抗癌藥物
metal complexes for biomedical application: anti-cancer drug cis-platin
Week 10
具⽣醫應⽤的⾦屬錯合物： Tc/Gd/Mn/Fe3O4 ⽣物影像顯影劑
metal complexes for biomedical application: contrast reagent for bioimaging
Week 11
具⽣醫應⽤的⾦屬錯合物：⼀氧化氮 / ⼀氧化碳傳遞
metal complexes for biomedical application: Delivery of nitric oxide/carbon
monoxide
Week 12
具⽣醫應⽤的⾦屬錯合物：藥物傳遞⾦屬奈米材料
metal complexes for biomedical application:   metal nanomaterial for drug
delivery
Week 13
具⽣醫應⽤的⾦屬錯合物：檢測⽤⾦屬奈米粒⼦
metal complexes for biomedical application:   metal nanoparticle for
diagnosis
Week 14
具⽣醫應⽤的⾦屬錯合物：基因傳遞⾦屬奈米粒⼦
metal complexes for biomedical application:   metal nanoparticle for gene
delivery
Week 15
期末考  Final exam
Week 16
期末報告  Oral Presentation
Week 17
國定假⽇  National Holiday
Week 18
期末報告  Oral Presentation
六、成績考核
期末考  Final exam (50%)
期末報告  oral presentation (50%)

科號  Course Number ：
11110BMES212100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 60
中文名稱  Course Title ：機率與統計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Probability and Statistics
任課教師  Instructor ：陳之碩
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W2 上課教室  Room ：醫環 110 ／ 72
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Description:
This is one-semester based introduction to probability and statistics for
undergraduate students in engineering. The course aims to provide elementary
topics needed for an understanding of basic statistics and its applications.
Topics cover probability, random variables, sampling, point estimation,
statistical intervals, test of statistical hypotheses, and linear regression.
Python with statistic toolbox will be introduced in class.
1.Text Book:
R26;Applied Statistics and Probability for Engineers,
Douglas C. Montgomery, 6th Edition, 2014. John Wiley & Sons
2.References:
R26;Essentials of Probability and Statistics for Engineers & Scientists Ronald
E.
Walpole, 2013. Pearson
R26;Statistics for Engineers and Scientists,
William Navidi, 4th Edition, 2014. McGraw-Hill
3.Teaching Methods:
Lectures
4.Syllabus:
1.Introduction to Statistics and Probability
2.Random variables
3.Probability distributions
4.Sampling distributions
5.Point estimation of parameters
6.Statistical intervals
7.Test of statistical hypotheses
8.Simple linear regression and correlation
A 3 hr lecture "applications of statistics in biomedical research"
will be delivered by Dr. Hsu-Chang Hao
5.Evaluation:
Midterm I (25%)
Midterm II (25%)
Final Exam (30%)
Homework/quiz (20%)

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The course will introduce the basic molecular architecture of living matter
and the genetic information.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Biochemistry
By Reginald H. Garrett and Charles M. Grisham, 6th edition, 2017
三、參考書籍 (References)
Handout will be offered in the class.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Oral Presentation
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Syllabus:
Chap. 1: The facts of life: Chemistry is the logic of biological phenomena
Chap. 2. Water: The medium of Life
Chap. 3. Thermodynamics of biolgoical systems
Chap. 4. Amino Acids and the peptide bond
Chap. 5. Proteins: their primary structure and biological functions
Chap. 6. Proteins: secondary, tertiary, and quaternary structure
Chap. 7. Carbonhydrates and the glycoconjugates of cell surfaces
Chap. 8. Lipids
Chap. 9: Membranes and membrane transport
Chap. 10: Nucleotides and nucleic acids
Chap. 11: Structure of Nucleic acids
Chap. 12: Recombinant DNA: cloning and creation of chimeric genes
Chap. 13: Enzymes-kinetics and specificity
Chap. 14: Mechanisms of enzyme action
Chap. 15: Enzyme regulation

上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：醫環 101 ／ 56
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程簡述  (Brief course description)
This course provides students with basic mathematics knowledge and computational
tools for solving science and engineering problems. Topics that will be covered
include modeling, computers and error analysis, roots and optimization, linear
systems, curve fitting, integration and differentiation, and ordinary differential
equations.
課程⼤綱  (Syllabus)
Course keywords: Numerical methods, modeling, roots and optimization, linear
systems, curve fitting, integration and differentiation.
Course description:
PART ONE Modeling, Computers, and Error Analysis
Chapter 1 Mathematical Modeling, Numerical Methods, and Problem
Solving
Chapter 4 Roundoff and Truncation
Errors
PART TWO Roots and Optimization
Chapter 5 Roots: Bracketing Methods
Chapter 6 Roots: Open Methods
Chapter 7 Optimization
PART FOUR Curve Fitting
Chapter 14 Linear Regression
Chapter 15 General Linear Least-Squares and Nonlinear Regression
Chapter 17 Polynomial Interpolation
PART FIVE Integration and Differentiation
Chapter 19 Numerical Integration Formulas
Chapter 20 Numerical Integration of Functions
Chapter 21 Numerical Differentiation
PART SIX Ordinary Differential Equations
Chapter 22 Initial-Value Problems
Textbook:
Steven C. Chapra, Applied Numerical Methods with MATLAB for Engineers and
Scientists, 4th., McGraw-Hill, (2018)
References:
1.Abdelwahab Kharab and Ronald B. Guenther, An Introduction to Numerical Methods -
A MATLAB Approach, 3rd Ed., CRCPress, (2012).
2. Michael R. King and Nipa A. Mody, Numerical and Statistical Methods for
Bioengineering, Cambridge University Press, (2011)
3. J. Douglas Faires and Richard L. Burden, Numerical Methods, 4th Ed.,Cengage,
(2013)
Evaluation:
Homework: 30%, Midterm: 30%, Final Exam: 40%

中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫材料
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Biomedical Materials
任課教師  Instructor ：胡尚秀
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F2 上課教室  Room ：醫環 717 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course is to provide the students who lack basic training in materials
science an introduction to the fundamental concepts of biomaterials, including
three types of biomaterials (metals, ceramics and synthetic and natural
macromolecules) and their chemical structure, physical properties, processing
and
applications. Biocompatibility of materials pertinent to their applications in
biomedical engineering is the other important issue to be given in this course.
This includes the interactions of biomaterials with proteins and cells and
biomaterial-elicited specific immune responses.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books)
1. W. D. Challister, Materials Science and Engineering, 8th Ed..
2. B. D. Ratner, Biomaterials Science, 3rd Ed., 2013.
3. S. V. Bhat, Biomaterials, Alpha Science, 2nd Ed., 2005.
4. W. Smith, Foundations of Materials Science and Engineering, McGraw-Hill, 2nd
Ed., 1993.
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
Contents
1. Introduction
2. Atomic structure and Bonding
3. Crystalline Solids
4. Imperfection in Solid
5. Strengthening Mechanism
6. Mechanical Properties of Materials
7. Phase Diagrams
8. Biomaterial Applications
9. Functional Biomaterials
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
30% The 1st Midterm Exam
30% The 2nd Midterm Exam
30% Final Exam
10% On-class discussion
100% Total

11110BMES337100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：物理化學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Physical Chemistry (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：吳劍侯
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W1W2 上課教室  Room ：醫環 717 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
開課對象 : 醫環系⼆年級以上
課程內容 :
Physical chemistry is the branch of chemistry that establishes and develops the
principles of the subjects. Its concepts are used to explain and interpret
observations on the physical and chemical properties of matter. Physical
chemistry is also essential for developing and interpreting the modern
techniques used to determine the structure and properties of matter. The
course will focus on the topic of equilibrium.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Engel, T.; Reid, P. Physical Chemistry, 3rd ed., Pearson New International
Edition, Pearson Education Limited, Harlow, Essex, England, 2014.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Atkins, P. W.; de Paula, J. C. Physical Chemistry, 10th ed., Freeman, New
York, NY, 2014.
2. Ball, D. W. Essentials of Physical Chemistry, Cengage Learning, Taipei,
Taiwan, ROC, 2014.
3. Silbey, R. J.; Alberty, R. A.; Bawendi, M. G. Physical Chemistry, 4th ed.,
John Wiley & Sons, New York, NY, 2005.
4. Mortimer, R. G. Physical Chemistry, 3rd ed., Harcourt/Academic Press, San
Diego, CA, 2008.
5. Laidler, K. J.; Meiser, J. H.; Sanctuary, B. C. Physical Chemistry, Houghton
Mifflin, Boston, MA, 2003.
6. McQuarrie, D. A.; Simon, J. D. Physical Chemistry: A Molecular Approach,
University Science Books, Sausalito, CA, 1997.
7. Levine, I. N. Physical Chemistry, 6th ed., McGraw-Hill, New York, NY, 2009.
8. Castellan, G. W. Physical Chemistry, Addison-Wesley, Reading, MA, 1983.
9. Klotz, I. M.; Rosenberg, R. M. Chemical Thermodynamics: Basic Theory and
Methods, 6th ed., John Wiley, New York, NY, 2000.

板書
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)

2nd Midterm Exam Chap. 5-7

14-15 Ideal and Real Solutions Chap. 9
16 Electrolyte Solutions Chap. 10
17 Electrochemical Cells Chap. 11
18 Final Exam Cover all

50% 2 Midterm Exams

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)

罪的兵
家四戰之地；耗能的八成是釋放巨量⼆氧化碳的含碳能源，同學們有⽣之年，應可親⾝體驗原油與天
然氣枯
竭、全球暖化與極端氣候的困局

各系均可
做為通識學分課程，亦列入跨院系能源科技與永續學分學程。本課程學期中不接受⼆階停修退選申
請，因應新
冠疫情，本課程依政府規定，亦可應急處置切換成遠距教學。本課程內容包括授、專題講座、影⾳教
學與堂課
習作，課堂電⼦講義教授於課前側傳電⼦檔⾄校園數位學習平台的 http://eeclass.nthu.edu.tw ，給修課

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Clinical Medicine

上課時間  Time ： W2W3W4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 401 ／ 47
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明
介紹臨床醫學的基本觀念，討論和其相關的議題，瞭解各科疾病，諸如 : 內科、外科、婦產
科、⼩兒科、急救等之臨
床表徵及其治療上的重點，當今治療⾯臨的問題，並學習與⽇常⽣活習習相關的醫療知識，最後
展望未來醫學發展，
推展⽣醫科技領域當中基礎與臨床之結合。
將專業艱澀的醫學知識，由受過醫環系教育的醫師整理介紹給醫環系或相關科系學⽣，藉以了
解醫環系的研究如何
在臨床醫學中找到相對應的研究題⽬。或是藉由課程的修習，能增加醫學常識，促進⾃⼰及周遭
親朋好友的健康。

教學進度
1. 9/14. Introduction & Questionnaire

4. 10/5. 泌尿科 : 前列腺肥⼤、性功能障礙、包莖、結⽯、泌尿⽣殖腫瘤學、不孕症
5. 10/12. 胸腔科 : 氣喘、咳嗽、肺癌、氣胸、 COVID-19 、呼吸衰竭、肺癌標靶治療、慢性阻塞
性肺病、空氣清淨機、過敏性肺炎、肺纖維化、細懸浮微粒  PM2 、 5
6. 10/19 婦產科 : ⼦宮出⾎、⽉經異常、經痛、骨盆器官脫垂、安全期、巧克⼒囊腫、懷孕、

中文名稱  Course Title ：分⼦⽣醫基礎
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Molecular Biomedicine
任課教師  Instructor ：莊淳宇  CHUANG CHUN YU
上課時間  Time ： W2W3W4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 101 ／ 56
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程名稱：分⼦⽣醫基礎
英文課名： Introduction to Molecular biomedicine
課程編號： BMES 520100; 學  分  數： 3
地點時間：醫環系 101R / Wednesday Morning 2nd, 3rd, 4th class (9:20-12:00)
授課教師：莊淳宇  / Room 217 / ext 34229 / cychuang@mx.nthu.edu.tw
講 義：  eeclass (https://eeclass.nthu.edu.tw/)
Purpose
This course consists of lecture topics, concept of lab technique and periodic
examinations for basic molecular biology and medicine. The students are expected
to develop a comprehensive understanding of molecular biology and to be able to
critically select necessary techniques in their own research. This course is
designed for the graduate and advanced undergraduate students interested in
molecular biomedicine even though without biology background.
Performance: Lecture, Presentation, Examination
Schedule
Lecture Topic [Lab Hint]
Introduction
Ch. 3, 4: DNA Nature [Ch. 21: Purification of nucleic acid]
Ch. 5: DNA Replication [Ch. 21: Detection of nucleic acid]
Ch. 6: Gene Transcription
Ch. 13: Mutations [Ch. 23: PCR]
Ch. 14: Repair
Ch. 22, 16: Recombinant DNA [Ch. 22: Restriction Endonucleases]
Ch. 9: Transcription in prokaryotes
Ch. 10: Transcription in eukaryotes [Ch. 25: Analysis of gene expression]
Ch. 11: Regulation of RNA level
Ch. 12: RNA processing
Ch. 7, 8: Protein synthesis (Translation)
Ch. 24, 26: Genomics, Proteomics
Text Book
David P. Clark. Molecular Biology, Academic Cell, 2nd edition, 2012 (ISBN-10:
0123785944).
Reference
1. James D. Watson. Molecular Biology of the Gene. Pearson.
2. Robert F Weaver. Molecular Biology. McGraw-Hill Education.
3.Roger L Miesfeld. Applied Molecular Genetics. Wiley-Liss, A John Wiley & Sons,
Inc.,
Publication.
4. Dennis W Ross. Introduction to Molecular Medicine. Spring.
Presentation: 5 groups
Grades: Midterm exam: 35%; Final exam: 35%, Presentation: 30%

中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫感測器
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Biomedical Sensors
任課教師  Instructor ：劉耕⾕
上課時間  Time ： M5M6M7 上課教室  Room ：醫環 101 ／ 56
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
中文名稱  Course title: ⽣醫感測器
英文名稱  Course English title: Biomedical Sensors
課程簡述  (Brief course description): This course will provide students with the
basic introduction of physical, chemical, and biological sensors. The purpose of
this course is to introduce the basic design and working principles of various
biomedical sensors that are currently used in biomedical research and the
healthcare industry. Recent advances and trends of biosensing technologies and
future biosensing platforms will also be discussed.
課程說明 (Course Description)
This course will provide students with the basic introduction of physical,
chemical, and biological sensors. The purpose of this course is to introduce the
basic design and working principles of various biomedical sensors that are
currently used in biomedical research and the healthcare industry. Recent advances
and trends of biosensing technologies and future biosensing platforms will also be
discussed.
指定⽤書  (Textbook): None
參考書籍  (References):
1. Florinel-Gabriel Banica, “Chemical Sensors and Biosensors: Fundamentals and
Applications”, 2012, John Wiley & Sons, Ltd
2. Ronald Pethig, Stewart Smith, “Introductory Bioelectronics: For Engineers and
Physical Scientists”, 2013, John Wiley & Sons, Ltd
教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures and presentations.
教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to Biosensors
2. Nucleotides, Nucleic Acids, DNA, and RNA
3. Protein Structures and Properties
4. Affinity-based Recognition
5. Materials and Methods in Sensor Manufacturing
6. Nanomaterial Applications in Chemical and Biological Sensors
7. Spectroscopic Techniques
8. Optical Biosensors: Principles and Applications
9. Electrochemical Biosensors: Principles and Applications
10. Electrical Biosensors: Principles and Applications
11. Gas Sensors: Principles and Applications
12. Medical Applications of Biosensors
成績考核 Evaluation:
Midterm 30 %
Final project and presentation 50 %
Participation 20 %

中文名稱  Course Title ：器官晶片與⼈⼯器官設計與應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Design and Application of Organ on a Chip and Bioartificial
Organ
任課教師  Instructor ：李亦淇
上課時間  Time ： T5T6T7 上課教室  Room ：醫環 501 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、  課程說明 (Course Description)
The aims of this course is to introduce the technology platforms, methodologies,
and the design of organ on a chip and artificial organs. Knowledge of organ on a
chip design and application will be introduce including brain on a chip, lung on
a chip, and disease on a chip. Various engineering issues surrounding the design
of artificial organs including biopolymers and biocompatibility, stem cell
technology, biomimetic systems, design principles for tissue and blood contact,
and control of artificial organs are emphasized. Knowledge to the design of
artificial organs including circulatory support devices, drug delivery systems,
artificial kidney, and other bioartificial organs are included.
⼆、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture
三、教學進度 (Syllabus)

L4. Biomimetic systems
L5. Design of microfluidic culture devices
L6. Brain on a chip
L7. Lung Airway Chip
L8. human Body-on-Chips and disease model
L9. Mid-term exam
L10. Introduction of bioartificial organ
L11. Whole-organ decellularization
L12. 3D organ bioprinting
L13. Organoid engineering
L14. Design and application of artificial organs
L15. Oral presentation
L17. Oral presentation
L18. Oral presentation

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The course will provide students with introduction to wearable biomedical devices and
its principle. The content includes abundant multidisciplinary technologies, including
circuit and system-level design, physics, electromagnetism, semiconductor process,
micro/nanotechnology, etc. The recent academic research and commercial biomedical
product will be presented and guide students to see the overview of current wearable
biomedical devices. The main goal of this course is to help students thoroughly
understand wearable biomedical device products from initial unmet needs to design, and
eventually fabrication technologies.
⼆、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures and presentations.
三、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to wearable biomedical device development
2. Cardiac electrophysiology and ECG device
3. Hemodynamics and blood pressure device
4. Photoplethysmography device
5. Capacitive sensor, piezoelectric sensor, magneto-plethysmographic sensor, and force-
sensitive sensor
6. Electromyography device
7. Electroencephalography device
8. Bio-impedance sensors (impedance plethysmography, electrical impedance spectroscopy,
and electrical impedance tomography)
9. Capacitive coupling sensor
10. Transcranial magnetic stimulation
11. Self-power sensors
12. Bio-MEMS
13. Chemical sensors

科號  Course Number ：
11110BMES544500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：醫學成像器材研發
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Development of Medical Imaging Instruments
任課教師  Instructor ：林曉均
上課時間  Time ： M5M6M7 上課教室  Room ：醫環 419 ／ 20
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course describes with the design and development process of imaging
instruments as biomedical devices. The goals are: 1) to provide a complete
overview of the medical device life cycle; 2) to revise imaging principals for
each main Medical imaging modalities (CT, MRI, ultrasound, optical methods); 3)
to understand the role phantoms play in system characterization and image quality
analysis, i.e. spatial resolution, contrast, FOV, homogeneity, temporal
resolution etc; 4) software analysis for each of these characteristics would be
discussed, and the various assessment metrics considered.
This course will be taught in English
⼆、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Alongside traditional lectures, there will be a substantial portion of the course
dedicated to dialog. This shall be achieved by posing open questions to students,
and encouraging discussions amongst the class.
References:
- “Biomedical devices: design, prototyping, and manufacturing” Özel, Tugrul et
al. John Wiley & Sons, 2016.
- “The phantoms of medical and health physics, Devices for Research and
Development” DeWerd, Larry Edited by Michael Kissick. Berlin: Springer, 2014.
- “Advanced biomedical image analysis” Haidekker, Mark. John Wiley & Sons, 2010.
- Hariri, Ali, Jorge Palma-Chavez, Keith A. Wear, T. Joshua Pfefer, Jesse V.
Jokerst, and William C. Vogt. "Polyacrylamide hydrogel phantoms for performance
evaluation of multispectral photoacoustic imaging systems." Photoacoustics 22
(2021): 100245.
三、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Week 1: Imaging instruments as Medical Devices
Week 2: Medical Device Design Process overview
Week 3: Verification, Validation, and the V model
Week 4: GMP and QMS
Week 5: Phantoms as QA tools
Week 6: Imaging Principals - a review and role of phantoms
Week 7: Project presentation (Part 1)
Week 8: Midterm
Week 9: Tissue mimicking material
Week 10: Dosimeters, Computational Phantoms
Week 11: Image analysis - Visualization and quantification metrics I
Week 12: Image analysis - Visualization and quantification metrics II
Week 13: Users perspective - Ergonomics and other considerations
Week 14: Imaging Phantoms: Applications
Week 15: Project presentation (Part 2)
Week 16: Finals
四、成績考核 (Evaluation)
40% Class attendance and participation
10% Project presentation
50% Midterm and Finals

11110BMES545300學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 14
中文名稱  Course Title ：神經科學研究⽅法
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Neuroscience research methods
任課教師  Instructor ：朱麗安
上課時間  Time ： R5R6 上課教室  Room ：醫環 418 ／ 20
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Neuroscience is a multidisciplinary research field. From the biological perspective, neuroscience involves
single neurons to a neuronal network (brain and central nerve system), and eventually this network conduct
animal behaviors. However, to reveal the mechanism of this sophisticated neuronal network, cutting edge
technologies such as automated behavior quantification software, super-resolution microscopy, AI image
analysis for circuit computation. In this class, we aim to study how to study a neuroscience question
systematically, and how these new technologies were brought into play to advance our understanding to the
neuroscience field.
⼆、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture and reports.
三、教學進度 (Syllabus)
（將原 18 週課程內的 1. Imaging 部分集中為⼀週上課，讓同學更能比較⼆種⼯具之差異 ; (2) 三週實驗
課程縮減為兩
週，課程內容不變但密集上課）
Week 1: Introduction of neuroscience research.
Week 2: Genetic tools for neuroscience research, part 1
Week 3: Genetic tools for neuroscience research part 2.
Week 4: Animal behavior assays.
Week 5: Electrophysiology
Week 6: Optical imaging for functional and structural imaging.
Week 7: Midterm
Week 8: Experiment (Animal behavior)
Week 9: Experiment (Functional and structural imaging)
Week 10-16: Case study (reports)
四、成績考核 (Evaluation)

Experiment report: 20%
Case study report: 40%

科號  Course Number ：
11110BMES548500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：超⾳波與光學：⽣醫技術與應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Ultrasound and Optics : Biomedical Imaging Techniques and
applications
任課教師  Instructor ：林曉均
上課時間  Time ： T5T6T7 上課教室  Room ：醫環 419 ／ 20
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The course will start with a revision on the motivations of biomedical imaging,
along with common techniques and challenges. Then, we will zoom in on ultrasound
imaging techniques: from acoustic wave propagation in tissue to the
understanding of transducers and image formation. As we explore system designs
and their applications, we will denote the characteristics and limitations of
the method. We will follow this by covering optical imaging. As we go from
fundamentals to systems and applications, and finally to challenges and outlook,
discussion will be steered towards its features complementary to those of
acoustic techniques. Finally, the last third section of the course will be on
the study of photoacoustic (optoacoustic) methods, where we combine optical
excitation and acoustic detection.
⼆、參考書籍  (References)
- Biomedical Optics: Principles and Imaging by Hsin-I Wu and Lihong V. Wang
- Photoacoustic Imaging and Spectroscopy by Lihong V. Wang
- Journal articles (Photoacoustics, Nature Photonics, Light: Science &
Applications, Theranostics...etc)
- Supplementary handouts
三、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
This course will be a combination of lectures and group discussions. Students
will be encouraged to deduct and reason for the purpose of developing critical
thinking as well as reinforce cognitive participation. Homework will be designed
to challenge the students’ literature search ability, along with analytical and
presentations skills.
四、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Course outline
1. Introduction: motivations, techniques, and challenges
2. Image characterization: common features
3. Ultrasound: intro and overview
4. Ultrasound: acoustic wave propagation
5. Ultrasound: transducers and image formation
6. Ultrasound: systems and applications
7. Optical Imaging: light propagation
8. Optical Imaging: methods and applications
9. Optical Imaging: summary
10. Photoacoustics: fundamentals
11. Photoacoustics: systems and applications
12. Photoacoustics: challenges and outlook
13. Summary
五、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Class participation (30%)
Assignment (40%)
Exam (30%)

科號  Course Number ： 11110CHE
211002學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 35
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼯程數學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Engineering Mathematics I
任課教師  Instructor ：潘詠庭
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  210 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Engineering Mathematics (I) covers the basics of the mathematical tools essential
for defining and solving
problems encountered by chemical engineers. These problems include by are not
limited to transport of maters
and energy, thermodynamics and separation processes, chemical reaction
engineering, process control, and
process design.
We will start our course with the introduction of 1st-order ordinary differential
equations (ODE). Such
equations are commonly encountered in simple chemical kinetics or steady-state
heat and mass transfer
problems. We will cover several types of ODE starting from separable homogeneous
ODE to general 1st-order
ODE. We will also cover 2nd-order ODE, which serves as an important foundation for
dealing with partial
differential equations students will encounter in non-steady state transfer
problems. Finally, toward the end
of the semester, we will cover some concepts in linear algebra and systems of ODEs
that can be used to deal with kinetics of series chemical reactions.
Below are some remarks for the course:
1. The lecture will be offered in English.
2. Final grades will be evaluated based on homework assignments (20%) and three
exams (20% for 1st, and 30% for the 2nd, and 30% for the 3rd exam).
3. Depending on the epidemic situation, the class may be given online in real time
through online meeting software such as google meet.
Detailed course syllabus will be provide in the first class of the semester.

科號  Course Number ： 11110CHE
241002學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 30
中文名稱  Course Title ：物理化學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Physical Chemistry (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：王潔
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W1W2 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  212 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、  課程說明 (Course Description)
Physical Chemistry I is a class focusing on gaining understandings toward chemical thermodynamics topics
such as work, heat, internal energy, heat capacity, enthalpy, entropy, free energy, Helmholtz free energy, Gibbs
free energy, Maxwell relations, chemical potential…etc. In this class, we will focus on (but not limited to) the
following topics:
1. The properties of gases
2. The first law of thermodynamics
3. The second law of thermodynamics
4. Physical transformations of pure substances
5. Simple mixture
6. Phase diagrams
7. Chemical equilibrium
After this class, you should be able to use the methods of equilibrium thermodynamics to describe the
properties and processes of macroscopic systems.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Physical Chemistry, Atkins 10th
三、參考書籍 (References)
Zemanksy, Mark, and Richard Dittman. Heat and Thermodynamics. 7th ed. McGraw-Hill Publishers.
Callen, Herbert B. Thermodynamics and an Introduction to Thermostatistics. Wiley.

Lectures
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Chapter 1 to Chapter7

Midterm I 30%
Midterm II 30%
Final 35%

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
傳統能源之⻑期使⽤已造成許多環境災害，有限的化⽯燃料亦為將來世界的能源體系埋藏潛伏性的
危機，發展綠⾊
能源已成為各界關注的焦點。綠⾊能源可分為再⽣能源與儲能技術，其中太陽能是極重要的再⽣能
源，在各國政府
積極的投入下，致使全球太陽光電產業以平均 30% 成⻑幅度順勢⽽起，也帶動對太陽電池的⾼度需
求，台灣包括聯
電、奇美等⼤廠相繼規劃投入。能源與環境將會是未來數⼗年⼈類所將會遇到的重要問題，所以希
望藉由此課程增
進學⽣跨領域綠⾊科技能源之素養，推廣綠⾊能源科技之創意活動，結合全校資源與產業界培育具
備綠⾊能源應⽤
及創新能⼒⼈才，與推廣再⽣能源應⽤科技於各系所，進⽽提昇我國綠⾊能源科技產業⼈才競爭
⼒。

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course introduces the basic laws of thermodynamics and its applications in
chemical engineering. The course contents include: the first and second laws,
volumetric properties, heat effects, thermodynamic properties of fluids,
solution thermodynamics, phase equilibrium, production of power from heat and
applications.

Thermodynamics", 9th ed., McGraw-Hill, 2021.

任課教師  Instructor ：胡啟章
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F4 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  209 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
教學⽬標：本課程在培養學⽣具備基礎的化學反應動⼒學與化學反應器之設計觀念，並對⽬前⼯業常
⽤
之化學反應器與相關技術作介紹。另外，透過教材，作業與文獻的導讀，使學⽣能從事相關問題之研
究。
授課⼤綱：
1. Introduction & Basic Concepts (Physical Chemistry)
2. Mole Balance & Reactors
3. Design Equations & Conversion
4. Rate Law & Stoichiometry
5. Interpretations of Collected Rate Data
6. Systems Involving Multiple Reactions
7. Kinetics of Non-Elementary Reactions
8. Design of Isothermal Reactors
9. Design of Steady-State Non-Isothermal Reactors
10. Catalysis & Catalytic Reactors
11. Effects of External Diffusion on Heterogeneous Reactions
Text Books:
H, Scott Fogler, “Elements of Chemical Reaction Engineering”, 3rd. ED., Prentice
Hall (1999) 。
Octave Levenspiel, “Chemical Reaction Engineering”, 3rd, ED. John Wiley & Sons
(1999)。

中文名稱  Course Title ：儀器分析及實驗⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Instrumental Analysis and Lab.(I)
任課教師  Instructor ：堀江正樹
上課時間  Time ： W6W7W8W9 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 202 ／ 70
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course description: Instrumental analysis is linked with many fields of
science and engineering. Due to the large number and diversity of instrumental
methods, beginners typically will need a large amount of work to collect the
necessary knowledge in order to understand of the fundamentals of the methods.
Instrumental Analysis is an integrated course of lectures and laboratories and
you will be exposed to a wide variety of analytical instrumentation and
techniques.
Required Text Book
Principles of Instrumental Analysis, 7th Ed., by Douglas A. Skoog et al.
Thomson Brooks/Cole, CA
Course introduction
Part I
Chapters 16-17: Infrared Spectrometry
Chapter 19: Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectrometry
Chapter 20: Mass Spectrometry
Chapters 16-20: Combination of Spectrometry
Exam #1
Part II
Chapters 9-12: Atomic Spectrometry
Chapters 13-15: Ultraviolet and Luminescence Spectrometry
Chapters 22-25: Electroanalytical Chemistry
Chapters 26-28: Chromatographic Separation, LC and GC
Chapter 31: Thermal Methods
Chapter 21: Surface Characterization by Spectroscopy and Microscopy
Exam #2
Part III
Lab experiments: Instruments will be selected from UV-vis & PL, IR, XRD, CV, GCMS,
HPLC, GPC, DSC & TGA,AA, and optical microscope, depending on availability.
Laboratory 1 (report)
Laboratory 2 (report)
Laboratory 3 (report)
Grading: Exam #1 (tentatively 40%), Exam #2 (tentatively 40%), Lab (tentatively
10%), in-class performance (tentatively 10%). Average and distribution of final
grade should be adjusted with another class.

352001學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 35
中文名稱  Course Title ：輸送現象及單元操作⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Transport Phenomena and Unit Operations(I)
任課教師  Instructor ：黃振煌
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W1W2 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  209 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
課程內容以流體⼒學之理論及相關之操作為主，包括：流體物性之介紹、 shell balance 、恆溫下連續⽅
程式及運動⽅程式之建立、 laminar flow 、 turbulent flow 、邊界層理論、介⾯動量傳送與摩擦係數，巨
觀流體流動及非⽜頓流體流動等現象。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Bird, R.B., W.E. Stewart, and E.N. Lightfoot, "Transport Phenomena," Revised 2nd ed., Wiley (2006)
三、參考書籍  (References)
1. 王茂齡 , “ 輸送現象 ” ⾼立圖書  (1993)
2. Stanley & Middleman, “An Introduction to Fluid Dynamics,” Wiley (1998).
3. R.B. Bird, W.E. Stewart, E.N. Lightfoot, and D.J. Klingenberg, “Introductory Transport Phenomena”, 1st
ed., Wiley (2015)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
投影片講解  (Slides presentation)
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Momentum Transfer (Chaps 1-8)
- Viscosity and Momentum Transport
- Shell Balances/Laminar Flow
- Equations of Change/Isothermal Systems
- Velocity Distributions in More than One Variable
- Velocity Distributions in Turbulent Flow
- Interphase Transport in Isothermal Systems
- Macroscopic Balances for Isothermal Flow Systems
- Polymeric Liquids
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework: 15%
Mid-term (Chaps. 1,2,3 and Appendix A): 25%
Final Exam (Chaps. 4,5,6,7,8): 30%
Final Presentation (Group project): 20%
Class Discussion: 10%

412000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：材料科學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Materials Science
任課教師  Instructor ：陳信文
上課時間  Time ： T1T2R1R2 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  210 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Materials science investigates the microstructure of materials and their
physical, chemical and mechanical properties. This course is divided into three
parts: (1) Microstructure of materials, atomic bonding and coordination, atomic
arrangement in crystals and crystal defects (especially the theory of vacancies
and dislocations). (2) Thermodynamics and kinetics of materials Science: phase
diagrams, solid diffusion and heat treatment, which are the basis for
controlling and changing the microstructure of materials. (3) Properties of
materials: discussing the physical, chemical, and mechanical properties of
metals, ceramics, composite materials, and semiconductors.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
”Foundations of Materials Science and Engineering”, 5th edition, by W. F. Smith
and J. Hashemi, McGraw Hill, 6th edition.
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture in English
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)

科號  Course Number ： 11110CHE
415002學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 30
中文名稱  Course Title ：程序設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Process Design
任課教師  Instructor ：林育正
上課時間  Time ： F7F8F9 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  210 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
This course aims to teach how to apply heat and material balance,
thermodynamics, process optimization, and unit operation method to design
chemical processes using process simulators. The students are expected to:
1. Understand the procedure for chemical process design and delivery
2. Apply basic knowledge of chemical engineering to design a chemical process
3. Calculate process economics and implement optimization
4. Gain open-ended problem-solving skill
5. Learn how to use chemical process simulators
6. Present the results through written reports and oral presentation
● 參考書籍 (References)
Warren D. Seider et al. Product and Process Design Principles: Synthesis,
Analysis and Design. Wiley 2016.
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures and group project assignment

455200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣物技術概論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Biotechnology
任課教師  Instructor ：胡育誠
上課時間  Time ： M2R1R2 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  B18 ／ 160
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  This course covers basic cell biology, fundamental genetic
engineering, cell culture, bioreactor design, downstream bioprocesses and
applications of biotechnology. In the end of the semester, the students are
grouped to design and present the production process, starting from genetic
engineering of the cells, production process (including bioreactor design and
operation) and downstream purification process.
計,下游程序⼯程 , ⽣物技術在特⽤化學品、抗⽣素等之應⽤
⼆、指定⽤書  Colin Ratledge, Bjorn Kristiansen. (2010) Basic biotechnology.
Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, UK.
三、參考書籍
Glick BR and Pasternak JJ. (2010) Molecular Biotechnology: Principles and
Applications of Recombinant DNA. 2nd ed. ASM Press, Washington, D.C.
四、教學⽅式  教師授課及與學⽣互動、學⽣報告為主
五、教學進度
六、成績考核  ⼀次期中考佔 40%, ⼩考佔 10%, 上課互動 (10% ，  回答問題 ) ，期末報告 40% ( 期
末考試以英文⼝頭取代 )
七、講義位址
http://www2.che.nthu.edu.tw/~biohu/
Syllabus
Basics
=548; Chap 1 Public Perception of Biotechnology
=548; Chap 2 Overview of Biological Systems
=548; Chap 3 Growth and metabolism
=548; Chap 4 Genetic Engineering-Procaryote
=548; Chap 5 Genetic Engineering-Yeast and Fungi
=548; Chap 6 Culture of Animal Cells
=548; Chap 7 Microbial Process Kinetics
=548; Chap 8 Bioreactor
=548; Chap 9 Downstream Processing
Applications:
=548; Chap 14 Amino Acids
=548; Chap 15 Organic Acids
=548; Chap 16 Microbial Polyhydroxyalkanoates, Polysaccharides and Lipids
=548; Chap 17 Bio-based Production of Chemicals
=548; Chap 18 Antibiotics
Final presentation suggestions:
=548; I recommend that 3 students form a group and each student gives a 10 min
presentation in English.
=548; Each group is free to select a bio-derived product (e.g. ethanol) as the
topic for presentation. You are advised to use the knowledge you learned in
class
for the presentation.
=548; The first student presents the background overview of the product, from
market, demand to the selection and/or genetic engineering of the cells. The
second student presents production process (including bioreactor design and
operation). The third student presents downstream purification process.

485000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：半導體材料與製造技術
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Semiconductor Materials and Manufacturing Technology
任課教師  Instructor ：謝昌志
上課時間  Time ： M6M7M8 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  212 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course shall introduce the fundamental semiconductor materials and
manufacturing technology. It will be covered include semiconductor history,
layout design, mask making, wafer process, package testing, future trends and
industry chain. Enable students to understanding the overall concept of
semiconductor engineering technology.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
本課程無指定⽤書  The course has no assigned textbook
三、參考書籍 (References)
Common reference books are listed below
“Semiconductor Physics & Devices”, 2nd Edition, Donald A. Neamen
“Introduction to Semiconductor Manufacturing Technology”, Hong Xiao
“Introduction to Microlithography”, 2nd Edition, Larry F. Thompson, C. Grant
Willson, M. J. Bowden
“Optical Lithography Here Is Why”, Burn J. Lin, SPIE press
Materials provided with the instructor
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂講授與討論  Oral Presentation and Class Discussion
客座演講  Guest lectures
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. 半導體產業鏈  Semiconductor Industry Chain
2. 半導體歷史與製造  Semiconductor History and Fabrication
3. 半導體的基礎  Semiconductor Basic
4. 晶圓製造技術  Wafer Fabrication Technology
5. 加熱製程  Thermal Process
6. 微影製程技術 -I Photolithography I, Track, Photoresist
7. 微影製程技術 -II Photolithography II, Stepper, DUV, EUV, RET
8. 電漿製程  Plasma
9. 離⼦佈植  Ion Implantation
10. 蝕刻技術  Etch
11. 介電質薄膜  Dielectric Thin Film
12. ⾦屬化製程  metallization
13. 化學機械研磨  Chemical Mechanical Polishing
14. 製程整合  Process Integration and yield enhancement
15. CMOS 製程技術  CMOS Process Technology
16. 未來趨勢  Future Trends
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Presence and homework: 30%
Mid-term test: 30%
Final test: 40%

中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼等化⼯熱⼒學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced Chem. Engineering Thermodynamics
任課教師  Instructor ：林昆翰
上課時間  Time ： R5R6R7 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 220 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
based on the foundation of classical thermodynamics, this course will introduce
the key concepts of statistical thermodynamics and show a few examples of its
applications. This includes the basic assumptions and how we could link the
microstates with the macrostates via ensemble theory. In addition, we will use
this tool to calculate thermodynamic variables (e.g. free energies) of simple
systems from their accessible quantum states.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Terrell L. Hill, An Introduction to Statistical Thermodynamics, Dover
Publications, 1986
Donald A. McQuarrie, Statistical Mechanics, 1st ed., University Science Books,
2000
三、參考書籍 (References)
Walter Greiner, Ludwig Neise, Horst Stöcker, Thermodynamics and Statistical
Mechanics, 1st ed., Springer, 2001
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
每週上課時數 3 ⼩時
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
- Brief review of classical thermodynamics
1. Fundamental laws and basic concepts
2. Thermodynamic variables and relations
- Quantum description of systems
1. Basic concepts and interpretation
2. Translation: particle in a box
3. Vibration: harmonic oscillator
4. Rotation: rigid rotor
- Statistical thermodynamics
1. Microstates and phase space
2. Ensemble theory and canonical ensemble
3. Grand canonical and microcanonical ensembles
4. Other ensembles and fluctuations
5. Ideal gas (monatomic, diatomic and polyatomic)
6. Monoatomic crystals
7. Classical statistical mechanics
8. Chemical Equilibrium
9. Imperfect gases
10.Quantum statistic
11.Molecular dynamics
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
5 Homework sets 30%
Midterm Exam 35%
Final Exam 35%

科號  Course Number ： 11110CHE
507000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：化⼯原理⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Chemical Engineering Principles (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：蔡德豪
上課時間  Time ： F2F3F4 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 220 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、  課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is designed to provide basic understanding of transport phenomena
and unit operations for graduate students with a non-chemical engineering
undergraduate background. It is divided into two parts. The first part takes 9
weeks to cover physical properties (viscosity, conductivity, diffusivity) and
(momentum, energy, mass) transport mechanisms, and shell balance techniques
for solving physical quantity (velocity, temperature, concentration)
distributions in simple transport problems. The second part focuses on several
key unit operations such as fluid delivery, mixing, separation and heating and
drying that are critical for students to learn so that they can apply some
basic knowledge and skill in this area when they start to work in domestic
plants.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Bird, R.B., W.E. Stewart, and E.N. Lightfoot, "Transport Phenomena," 2nd ed.,
Wiley (2002)
三、參考書籍 (References)
王茂齡 , “ 輸送現象 ” ⾼立圖書  (1993)
Middleman, S., “An Introduction to Fluid Mechanics” and “An Introduction to
Mass and Heat Transfer”, Wiley(1998)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
lectures
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Transport phenomena: 3 weeks for momentum transport, 3 weeks for energy
transport, and 3 weeks for mass transport
Unit operations: Fluid delivery (2 weeks), mixing(2 weeks), separation (2
weeks), heating and drying(2 weeks).
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Transport Phenomena:
1 Midterm Examination 45%
Weekly in-class practice 10%
Unit operations:
1. Final Examination 25%
2. Project & presentation 20%

課程說明 /Course Description and objective
-------
此課程將會介紹代謝⼯程領域中所需的基礎分⼦⽣物技術，微⽣物之各式代謝途徑，及其在⽣質燃

科號  Course Number ： 11110CHE
516500學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 60
中文名稱  Course Title ：溫室氣體減量技術
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Greenhouse gas control technologies
任課教師  Instructor ：林育正
上課時間  Time ： F3F4 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 202 ／ 70
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
Net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 is necessary to limit the global temperature
increase within 1.5 C and avoid irreversible damage from global warming. Fossil
fuel power plants are responsible for the most carbon emissions among the
anthropogenic sources. Carbon capture and sequestration (CCS) is an essential
technology to decarbonize power generation and achieve the net-zero carbon
emission target. This course will focus on the CCS technology development in
the context of mitigating the global warming. In this class, the students will
be expected to learn:
1.The greenhouse gas sources and the mitigation methods
2.The low-emission power generation technology
3.The carbon capture and sequestration technology with amine scrubbing
4.Current status of carbon capture in industry
● 參考書籍 (References)
Paul H.M. Feron, Absorption-based Post-combustion Capture of Carbon Dioxide,
Woodhead Publishing, 2016
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures, assignments, midterm exam, and final report
科號  Course Number ： 11110CHE
517000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼等程序控制
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced Process Control
任課教師  Instructor ：鄭⻄顯
上課時間  Time ： W2W3W4 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 220 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
由於化⼯程序常是多變數、非線性及具有時延性質，因此課程著重在上述問題的分析與控制系統的設
計，同時也考慮最佳控制。課程包括座標系統之轉換、狀態空間表⽰法、矩陣分析、狀態空間解析、
觀
察度、控制度、穩定分析、最佳控制及數值解題⽅法等。
This course extends chemical process control problem to the areas of multi-
variable, nonlinear and time-delay processes. We will focus the analyses of the
control problems of the above processes. Meanwhile, the design of advanced process
control systems will also take care. The details of the course will include
transformation of state space system, matrices expression of process models,
observability, controllability and stability analyses,…etc.. Optimal control and
numerical analysis will be studied to solve these problems.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Seborg, D.E., Edgar T.F. and Mellichamp, D.A., Process Dynamics and Control, Wiley
& Sons, Inc., 2004.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Thomas M. Marlin, Process Control- Designing Processes and Control System for
Dynamic Performance, 2nd Edition, McGraw-Hill International Editions, 2000.
2. Ogunnaike, B.A and Ray, W.H., Process Dynamics, Modeling and Control, Oxford,
New York, 1994.
3. Luyben, W.L., Process Modeling, Simulation and Control for Chemical Engineers,
2nd Edition, McGraw-Hill International Editions, 1990.
4. Smith, C.A. and Corripio, Principles and Practice of Automatic Process Control,
2nd Edition, John Wiley & Sons, New York, 1997.
5. Patrick, D.R. and Fardo, S.W., Industrial Process Control Systems, Delmar
Publishers, Albony, New York, 1997.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂演講，習題 ( 含電腦模擬 )
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1-2週：複習 Process control
3-5週： Cascade, Feed forward , Selected Control.
6-8週： Multi-variable Control.
9-12週： Digital Computer Control
13-15週： Model Prediction control

科號  Course Number ： 11110CHE
522500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼩⾓度散射原理與應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Principles and Applications of Small Angle Scattering
任課教師  Instructor ：陳信龍
上課時間  Time ： T2T3T4 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 220 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
This course will cover the principles and applications of small angle X-ray and
neutron scattering, which are important tools for exploring the nanostructures,
thermodynamics and dynamics of matters. The objective is to provide the
students a solid background on these techniques, which may be
helpful for their research in related subjects. The topics covered in this
course are outlined as follows.
1. Basics of X-ray and Neutron Scattering
2. Small Angle Scattering
2. Applications to Polymer Blends and Block Copolymers
4. Application to Amorphous Polymers
5. Study of Surfaces and Interfaces
6. Inelastic Scattering for Dynamics Studies
The materials taught in class will be based largely on the book of:
R. J. Roe, “Methods of X-ray and Neutron Scattering in Polymer Science”, Oxford
University Press (2000)
Two exams will be held and a final written report is required.

545400學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 25
中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼等⾼分⼦化學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced Polymer Chemistry
任課教師  Instructor ：劉英麟
堀江正樹
上課時間  Time ： T5T6T7 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 202 ／ 70
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Polymer chemistry is significantly important for chemical engineering students.
New polymers with required functions can be developed by taking advantage of
chemical synthesis and various polymerization methods. This course deals with
polymer design and synthesis both at the fundamental and the advanced level.
Various polymerization methods, as listed below, are introduced in this course.
In addition, they are related to the latest academic research and industrial
applications.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
George Odian,“Principles of Polymerization,” 4th Ed., Wiley: New York, 2004.
(E-book is available from the library.)
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Presentation, group discussion, and in-class quiz
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
劉英麟  Ying-Ling Liu
1. Step Polymerization
2. Radical Chain Polymerization
3. Ionic Chain Polymerization
堀江正樹  Masaki Horie
4. Chain Copolymerization
5. Ring-Opening Polymerization
6. Sterochemistry of Polymerization

Final exam 50%
科號  Course Number ： 11110CHE
554000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 20
中文名稱  Course Title ：微流體系統於化⼯之應⽤與實作
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Microfluidic System: Application and Implementation in
Chemical Engineering
任課教師  Instructor ：黃振煌
上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  210 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course mainly combines three parts. First, students will understand the fundamental aspects of kinetics,
mass-transport, fluid physics, design principle, and the use of software that are relevant to microfluidic
systems. Second, course will provide an understanding of current challenges in Chemical Engineering field.
Finally, students in the course will work together in several groups to design and fabricate microfluidic
systems or devices that address challenges in Chemical Engineering, with an emphasis on students' inventive
contributions and creativity. Participants in this course benefit from enrollment of students with diverse
backgrounds and interests. For chemical engineers, suggested but not required courses are CHE 352 (Transport
Phenomena and Unit Operations), CHE 306 (Chemical Engineering Unit Operations), and CHE 415 (Process
Design). Students are encouraged to contact the instructor to discuss enrollment.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Lecture notes are available during lecture.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1.“Transport Phenomena in Microfluidic Systems” by P. K. Panigrahi, Wiley, 2015
2.“Micro- and nanoscale fluid mechanics : transport in microfluidic devices” by B. J, Kirby, 2010
3. “Unit Operations of Chemical Engineering” 7th edition by W. McCabe, J. Smith, P. Harriott, 2004
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture, experiment, and interaction with students
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
- Introduction of fluidic mechanics, heat transfer, mass transfer
- Current challenges in Chemical Engineering
- Design principles and software
- Fabrication methods
- Suggestion and discussion
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Mid-term Presentation I– Introduction and current challenges, 25%
Mid-term Presentation II–Ideas, innovation and design, 25%
Implementation– Fabrication and Test , 10%
Final Presentation –Results, Discussion and Conclusion, 40%

四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
本課程將以英文授課，每章均以 power point 格式播放上課材料，並⼝頭闡述之，學⽣可以隨時提
出問題。每章材料均在上課發放。
This course will be taught in English. Each chapter teaching materials will be
provided in hard copy of power point format along with oral demonstration.
Students are allowed to rise question at anytime in the class.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
上課共 18 周  (2020.09.14-2021.01.11; no holiday)
考試 : 1次  (final exam 2021.01.11 oral reporting)
課程⽬錄  (Course content)
1. Introduction,
2. Photochemistry
3. Device physics
4. Materials chemistry and physics
5. Emitting species and charge transport
6. Organic light emitting diode (OLED)
7. Polymer light emitting diode (PLED)
8. Organic field effect transistor (OFET, including small molecules and,
Polymers)
9. organic Solar Cell (including small molecules, polymers and quantum dots)
10. Organic Memory Device
11. e-Book
12. Touch panel display
11. Processing technology
12. Flexible electronics
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
全學期考試 1 次，各選課學⽣將依所指定的題⽬尋找資料，並準備書⾯報告 (power point 格式 ) 於
上課時作⼝頭闡述約 20 分鐘。
There is one examination at the end of the semester. Each student will be
assigned a topic for searching on recent progress in that topic; he/she will
then write up a report in power point format and give an oral presentation in
about 20 minutes.

160
中文名稱  Course Title ：有機化學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Organic Chemistry (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：汪炳鈞  UANG BIING JIUN
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3F4 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆講堂／ 320
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Chem221002 : Organic Chemistry (I)
1. Electronic Structures and Bonding;
2. Acids and bases
3. An Introduction to Organic Compounds
4. Isomers: The arrangement of atoms in space
5. Alkenes
6. The Reactions of Alkenes
7. The Reactions of Alkynes
8. Delocalized Electrons and Their Effect on stability, ....
9. Substitution and Elimination Reactions of Alkyl Halides
10. Reactions of Alcohols, Amines,.....
11. Organometallic Compounds
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Bruice, P. Y., "Organic Chemistry," 8th. Ed., Prentice Hall, 2016.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Wade, L. G. Jr., "Organic Chemistry," 8th Ed., Prentice Hall, 2013.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
教學⽅式使⽤ Power Point 為主、⿊板為輔。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
另⾏通知
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
三次期中考各佔 20% 、期末考佔 30% 、隨堂考及其他平時表現佔 10% 。

References:
1. Erich Steiner, The Chemistry Maths Book, 2nd edition, (2008).
2. Donald A. McQuarrie, Mathematics for Physical Chemistry, 1st edition, (2008).
3. Donald A. McQuarrie, Mathematical Methods for Scientists and Engineers, 1st edition, (2003).
4. Robert G. Mortimer, Mathematics for Physical Chemistry, 4th Edition, (2013).
Course objectives:
This course is an introduction to applied mathematics required by chemistry undergraduate students including
multivariable calculus, linear algebra, and ordinary differential equations. Examples will be drawn from a
variety of scientific and mathematical areas.
Course Outline: (topics to be covered and order of presentation subject to change)
1. Complex numbers
2. Differential and integral calculus in several variables
3. Linear algebra
‧ Determinants
‧ Vector spaces
‧ Matrices and linear transformations
‧ The matrix eigenvalue problem
4. Operators
5. Ordinary differential equations
‧ First-order differential equations
‧ Second-order differential equations: Constant coefficients
‧ The power series method
Course Grades:
Homework (10%)
3 Exams: Exam 1 (30%); Exam 2 (30%); Exam 3 (30%)

中文名稱  Course Title ：無機化學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Inorganic Chemistry (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：王育恒
黃暄益
上課時間  Time ： M1M2R1R2 上課教室  Room ：化  B07 ／ 105
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
Basic knowledge of inorganic chemistry will be taught in this course.
The content includes:
Topic 1: Introduction
Topic 2: Atomic Structure
Topic 3: Symmetry and Group Theory
Topic 4: Simple Bonding Theory
Topic 5: Molecular Orbitals
Topic 6: Acid-base and Donor-Acceptor Chemistry
Topic 7: Reduction and Oxidation
Topic 8: The Crystalline Solid State
Topic 9: Chemistry of the Main Group Elements
Topic 10: Coordination Chemistry I: Structures and Isomers
⼆、指定書籍  (Textbooks)
Inorganic Chemistry, 5th Ed.
Authors: Catherine E. Housecroft and Alan G. Sharpe
Publisher: Pearson Prentice Hall
三、參考書籍  (References)
Inorganic Chemistry, 5th ed.
Authors: Gary L. Miessler and Donald A. Tarr
Publiser: Pearson Prentice Hall
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures will be mainly presented by slides.
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
The content includes: atomic structure, molecular symmetry, group theory, MO
theory, acid-base chemistry, solid state chemistry, reduction and oxidation,
chemistry of main group elements, organometallic complexes.
Special emphasis this time will include more presentation on the structural
characterization and properties of nanoscale inorganic materials.
六、成績考核  (Evaluation)
期中考 : 上課內容與課本習題。  => 100 分  x 2 = 200
期末考 : 上課內容與課本習題。  => 100 分  x 1 = 100

任課教師  Instructor ：楊家銘

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
General course information:
Course title/number: Analytical techniques in materials chemistry / CHEM5430
Time: R2R3R4
Location: 化學館  326 教室
Credit: 3
Instructor information:
Name: 楊家銘（ Chia-Min Yang ）
Office: 化⼆館  225A 室
Ext: 31282
e-mail: cmyang@mx.nthu.edu.tw
Contents of the course:
1) Introduction to techniques for surface analysis
X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS), Auger electron spectroscopy (AES), low energy electron diffraction
(LEED), scanning probe microscopy (SPM)
2) X-ray diffraction (XRD)
Principles of X-ray crystallography, powder X-ray diffraction
3) X-ray absorption spectroscopy (XAS)
Principles of X-ray absorption spectroscopy, experimental methods and data analysis
4) Gas physisorption analysis
Fundamentals of physisorption, BET method, BJH method, t-plot analysis
5) Electron microscopies and related analytical techniques
Scanning electron microscopy (SEM), transmission electron microscopy (TEM), energy-dispersive X-ray
spectrometry (EDS), electron energy-loss spectroscopy (EELS)

Not available.

11110CHEM545000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：量⼦化學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Quantum Chemistry
任課教師  Instructor ：周佳駿
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3F4 上課教室  Room ：化⼆  223 ／ 109
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
References:
1. Donald A. McQuarrie, Quantum Chemistry, 2nd edition, (2007).
2. Ira N. Levine, Quantum Chemistry, 7th edition, (2014).
3. Peter W. Atkins and Ronald S. Friedman, Molecular Quantum Mechanics, 5th edition, (2010).
4. David J. Griffiths and Darrell F. Schroeter, Introduction to Quantum Mechanics, 3rd edition, (2018).
5. David H. McIntyre, Quantum Mechanics: A Paradigms Approach, 1st edition, (2012).
6. Michael D. Fayer, Elements of Quantum Mechanics, 1st edition, (2001).
Course prerequisites:
Physical Chemistry II and Applied Mathematics.
Course objectives:
We will introduce fundamental concepts and approximation methods in molecular quantum mechanics.
Course Outline:
1. Introduction to the Schrodinger equation
2. Particle in a box; Free particle; Particle in a 2D box
3. Elements of linear algebra; Dirac notation
4. Operators; Eigenfunctions and eigenvalues; Hermitian operator
5. Matrix representation of quantum mechanics; Two well system; Huckel theory
6. Foundations of quantum mechanics
7. Harmonic oscillator
8. Rotational motion and the angular momentum
9. The Hydrogen atom
10.Techniques of approximation: the variation method and the time-independent perturbation theory
11. Electron spin; Pauli exclusion principle; Slater determinant
12. Many-electron atoms: Helium atom; Atomic term symbols; Hund's rules
13. Molecular structure: The Born-Oppenheimer approximation; Molecular orbital theory; The hydrogen
molecule ion and the hydrogen molecule
Course Grades:
Homework (10%)
3 Exams: Exam 1 (30%); Exam 2 (30%); Exam 3 (30%)
