11110EMBA508900學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 50
中文名稱  Course Title ：服務科學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Service Science
任課教師  Instructor ：林福仁  LIN FU REN
上課時間  Time ： S2S3S4 上課教室  Room ：台積 901 ／ 68
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
國立清華⼤學科技管理學院
EMBA508900
服務科學
(Introduction to Service Science)
課程⼤綱
授課教師：林福仁教授  (frlin@iss.nthu.edu.tw)
課程時間：星期六上午 9:00~12:00
上課地點：台積館 901 教室
課程簡介：
眾所週知，世界已經邁向了服務經濟的時代。「服務」存在⼈類社會遠在所謂的「服務業」的產業分
類。但究竟
「服
務」是什麼？⽽當 IBM 於 2004 年倡導所謂的「服務科學」，或者後來加上⼯程與管理，統稱「服務科
學⼯程與管
理」 (Service Science, Management, and Engineering, SSME) 。近年來，在原有的 SSME 外加上
Design，成為現在
⼀般談及服務科學時，以 SSMED 來描述它。究竟其內涵與實質內容為何？究竟服務科學的範圍與議題
為何？服務
科
學與現有的學術與實務領域有何關聯？如何將服務科學的理論應⽤於實務上？實務上的議題與需求如
何來成為服
務科
學的研究內容與貢獻？本課程的課程內容規劃即在滿⾜⼤家對服務科學的好奇⼼。同時也希望學⽣能
勇敢地探索
此⼀
新的領域，成為服務科學發展學術與實務社群的⽣⼒軍。
本課程的⽬標簡述如下：
1. 學⽣能完整定義服務科學的內涵與範疇。
2. 學⽣能應⽤服務體驗設計，進⾏服務設計。
3. 學⽣能分析與規劃服務價值網絡以提供服務價值。
4. 學⽣能針對不同的產業提出創新的服務模式。
5. 學⽣能指出重要的服務科學相關的重要議題，進⾏研究。
本課程的內容與教學具有以下的特⾊：
1. 理論與實務並重；
2. 講授與個案教學相輔相成；
3. 實作專案，內化知識與能⼒。
課程模組與主題：
⼀、服務科學簡介
1. What is service science?
2. Service science, the revolution vs. the evolution?
3. Service economy, where does the service value come from?
4. Service innovation, what can be counted as service innovation?
⼆、服務體驗設計
1. How do you know potential customers’ needs?
2. Methods for service design and engineering
3. New service development (NSD)
4. New service development project management.
三、服務價值網絡
1. How to articulate segmented business processes as a value added service
network?
2. How to add service value to products?
四、資訊科技與服務科學
1. IT service
2. Service-oriented Architecture (SOA)
3. Cloud computing and service
四、服務科學與服務開放創新
1. Service open innovation
2. Service experimentation
3. Service quality
4. Service globalization
評分要點：課程參與： 50% 專案： 50%

11110EMBA510700學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 35
中文名稱  Course Title ：公司治理與法律
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Corporate Governance and the Law
任課教師  Instructor ：蔡昌憲
上課時間  Time ： MbT9 上課教室  Room ：台積 905 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明：
本課程主要介紹台灣公司法制以及公司治理相關的國內外議題。公司法制 (corporate law
system)，係指容許公司 ( 主要是股份有限公司 ) 運作之法制環境 (institutional ecology) 。⾃我國
法典⾯⽽⾔，其乃以公司法與證券交易法為核⼼；其他較外環之配套法規包括例如：⾦融法規、⺠
法、稅法、企業併購法、與投資者保護有關之程序法規 ( 如代表訴訟、團體訴訟等機制 ) ，亦包含相關
主管機關 ( 如經濟部、⾦管會、證交所、櫃買中⼼ ) 公布之規範。課程安排上，本課程將重點討論公司
治理運作之基本原則、台灣公司法制之基本法律架構、以及股東與管理階層間之法律關係。再者，本
課程亦將邀請法律實務界⼈⼠就公司治理法制之特定熱⾨議題到課堂上演講，以利學員在理論與實務
上的融會。
⼆、參考書籍（暫定）：
教師會事先準備指定閱讀資料，並於課堂上發給每位學員。
三、教學⽅式：
本課程係以「討論」為主，故希望學員能積極參與課堂討論。每堂課在教師說明當次討論主題之背景
後，即進入課堂討論。教師期待每位學員能主動地積極參與討論，並與其他學員分享閱讀指定資料之
⼼得或其他個⼈研究觀察之想法。應注意者，學員將分組且推選出組⻑。
四、教學進度（暫定）：
(1) 公司治理與公司法制
(2) 電影與公司治理
(3) 經濟犯罪的法律思惟
(4) 投保中⼼、商業法院與公司治理
(5) 董事引領 ESG 永續轉型計畫的策略與挑戰
(6) 董事會與獨立董事
五、成績考核（暫定）：
(1) 課程參與 ( 含分組上台報告與課堂上的主動發⾔ ) ： 70% 。
(2) 出席率： 30% 。

COURSE DEscriptION
The goal of this course is to introduce the fundamental principles of corporate finance to students. An
emphasis will be placed upon on (1) Introduction to Corporate Finance and Financial Statement Analysis, (2)
Value and Capital Budgeting, (3) Risk and Return Analysis, (4) Capital Structure and Dividend Decision, and
(5) Other related Financial Topics.

11110EMIM501300學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 44
中文名稱  Course Title ：先進製造技術
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced Manufacturing Technology
任課教師  Instructor ：陳鴻文
李明蒼
上課時間  Time ： S2S3S4 上課教室  Room ：綜四 219 ／ 38
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
This course aims to teach the working principles and applications in advanced
manufacturing technology.
The course is mainly divided into two parts, thermofluids for advanced
manufacturing and industrial laser machining.
In the first part of the course, an introduction and review to the physics of
thermodynamics, fluid mechanics and heat transfer will be provided to build
the background on these subjects. To illustrate their applications in advanced
manufacturing technologies, three specific topics encompassing manufacturing
systems to manufacturing processes will be discussed: optimal design of
semiconductor manufacturing systems, active thermal management for high
precision machining center, and low temperature laser microfabrication
processes.
In the second part of the course, the course will start from introducing
miscellaneous applications of industrial machining with various types of
lasers which are different in wavelengths, pulse duration, and pulse energies.
The underlying physics phenomena in the process of laser machining will then
be studied. The simulation tools for simulating the multi-physics processes
will be introduced as well.

本課程提供初學者認識真實世界的經濟活動及其背後蘊含的經濟理論的基本概念。除供學⽣作為  認

12. ⾦融體系與銀⾏

of crystals, suitable for beginning graduate students of engineering.
Preliminary requirement: modern physics.

2. reciprocal lattices
3. crystal vibrations from atomic viewpoint
4. elastics
5. free electron model
6. energy band structures
7. semiconductor crystals

3. final test

中文名稱  Course Title ：數位積體電路

上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3 上課教室  Room ：台達 211 ／ 51
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course will cover the fundamentals of digital circuits in the state-of-the-art CMOS technologies. Special
attention will be devoted to the impact of scaling, nano-CMOS effects, interconnect, signal integrity, power
consumption, and timing.

Nikolic

科號  Course Number ： 11110ENE
531000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 96
中文名稱  Course Title ：微電⼦⼯程
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Silicon Processing Technology for Microelectronics
任課教師  Instructor ：楊雅棠
上課時間  Time ： T6R5R6 上課教室  Room ：資電  208 ／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Overview of the Course:
This is more of a senior/graduate course on microfabrication and nanofabrication technology. The time
has gone from VLSI to ULSI (as many include this as nanotechnology), silicon substrate to glass
substrate, and even from glass substrate to plastic substrates. This course is designed to cover the
fundamental theory and state-of-the-art micro/nano technologies for the make of silicon based
integrated circuits, information display, and MEMS.
Main Course Materials:
Class Notes and textbook
Midterm and final:
One midterm and final exam will be given. They are closed book exams. Homework:
There will be problem sets in total. Homework solutions will be available after your homeworks are
graded. Late homeworks will have no credit. No collaboration on homeworks is allowed.
Reference Books
1. C.Y. Chang and S.M. Sze, “ULSI Technology,” 1996, McGraw-Hill Book Co.
2. S.M. Sze, "VLSI Technology," 1983, McGraw-Hill Book Co.
3. Hong Xiao, “Introduction to Semiconductor Manufacturing Technology,” 2001
ISBN: 0131911368, Prentice Hall
Syllabus (topics to be covered):
1. Introduction
2. Lithography
3. Oxidation, diffusion, and ion implementation
4. Etching
5. Chemical vapor deposition
6. metalization and physical vapor deposition
7. Process Integration
Detailed Syllabus:
1. Introduction
(1) Historical overview
(2) Device physics : MOSFET, BJT, a-Si TFT, MEMS example etc.
(3) VLSI and ULSI (silicon technology)
(4) TFT-LCD Display and solar (large area macroelectronics)
(5) MEMS
(6) Manufacturing platform and architechture: vacuum systems (vacuum pumps and plasma), wet
systems, inject, and roll to roll systems.
(7) Substrate materials: silicon ingot, fusion process for non-alkali glass, and other novel substrates
(8) Clean room fundamentals: Intel 45nm fab 10min video
(9) Comments on IP and patents
(10) Elements used in microfabrication overview
2. lithography
(1) General overview and comparision
(2) Photoresist
(2) Optical lithography
(3) Electron beam lithography
(4) X-ray lithography
(4) Nano imprint lithography
(5) Other novel lithography technique
3. Oxidation, diffusion, and ion implentation
4. Dry etching and wet etching
(1) Plasma fundamentals (CCP, ICP, microwave ECR, remote plasma, VHF), match, scaling effect
(2) General consideration: Etching rate, selectivity, anisotropic, loading
(3) XeF2 gas phase etching as an example
(4) RIE (reactive ion etching)
(5) ICP and microwave ECR etching
(6) DRIE for micromachining
(8) Remote (downstream) plasma etching
(7) Diagnostics (OES)
(8) Plasma induced damage
(9) Fluorocarbon chemistry
(10) Other etching chemistry
(11) Wet etching of oxide, nitride, and silicon
5. Chemical vapor deposition
(1) Chemical reaction W22;general consideration transportation limited and diffusion limited
(2) Process parameters
(3) AP CVD (atomosphere and low pressure chemical vapor deposition) and LPCVD (low pressure
chemical vapor deposition)
(4) PECVD (plasma enhanced chemical vapor deposition) CCP
(5) HDP (high density plasma) for ILD
(6) Oxide deposition (gate, ILD etc.) (SiH4 based oxide and TEOS based oxide)
(7) Nitride deposition
(8) Polysilicon and amorphous deposition (LTPS application)
(9) Catalytic CVD for nanotube
(10) Commonly used gas
6. metalization and physical vapor deposition
(1) Physical vapor W22;general consideration
(2) Thermal and e-beam evaporation
(3) Magnetron sputtering (PVD)
(4) atomic layer deposition (ALD)
(5) Chemical mechanical polishing for planarzation
(6) inter layer dielectric (ILD) deposition, HDP gap fill
(7) Electroplating
(8) MOCVD
(8) ITO sputtering as TCO (transparent conducting oxide)
7. Special topics : Polymer microfabrication, chemical mechanical polishing

中文名稱  Course Title ：積體電路元件
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Semiconductor Devices for Integrated Circuits
任課教師  Instructor ：黃智⽅
上課時間  Time ： W5W6F5 上課教室  Room ：資電  206 ／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
This course aims to provide entry level graduate students with basic knowledge
and training in the field of semiconductor devices that are mostly used in
integrated circuits. The course content covers basic semiconductor physics, PN
junctions, Bipolar Junction Transistors, and metal-Oxide-Semiconductor Field
Effect Transistors, and some advanced devices. The students will learn physics,
design principles, and circuit models of these devices.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
● 參考書籍 (References)
D. Neamen, Semiconductor Physics and Devices: Basic Principles (4th Edition),
McGraw-Hill, 2012.
R. Pierret, Advanced Semiconductor Fundamentals (2nd Edition), Pearson, 2002.
C. Hu, Modern Semiconductor Devices for Integrated Circuits, Pearson, 2010.
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂講授或是遠端教學 ( 視疫情狀況⽽定 )
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction / Crystal Structure of Solids
2. Quantum Mechanics / Schrodinger Equation
3. Energy Bands / Energy Bands in 3D Crystals
4. Density of States / Fermi-Dirac Statistics
5. Doping / Equilibrium Statistics / Carrier Conc.
6. Non-Equilibrium Statistics: Recombination-Generation
7. Carrier Transport / Semiconductor Equations
8. PN Junction Electrostatics / I-V Characteristics
9. PN Junctions – non-ideal / AC Resp. / Trans
10. metal-Semiconductor Junctions
11. Bipolar Transistors I
12. Bipolar Transistors II
13. MOS Electrostatics
14. MOSFETS: Ideal
15. MOSFETS: Advanced/Nonideal
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
3 Exams 100%

科號  Course Number ： 11110ENE
540000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 40
中文名稱  Course Title ：微機電系統設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Micro Electro Mechanical Systems (MEMS) Design
任課教師  Instructor ：盧向成
上課時間  Time ： W3W4R2 上課教室  Room ：台達 208 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The promise of better performance, lower cost and miniaturization of sensor
and actuator systems has motivated growth in the area of
MicroElectroMechanical Systems (MEMS). MEMS technology has been widely applied
in Internet of Things (IoT), with applications found in inertial navigation,
data storage, micromanipulation, optical communication, biochemical analysis,
and microfluidic systems.
In addition to the basic MEMS contents on microfabrication,
micromechanical/biochemical sensors and actuation mechanisms, this course will
cover advanced design topics such as low-noise sensor readout design, MEMS
control and MEMS system-level design methodology.
based on the syllabus and objectives of this course, I expect students to end
the course with analytical skills in designing a mechanical sensors such as
capacitive accelerometers.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
None.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Gregory T.A. Kovacs, Micromachined transducers sourcebook, The McGraw-Hill,
Inc., 1998.
2. Stephen D. Senturia, Microsystem design, Kluwer Academic Publishers, 2001.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Powerpoint presentation and blackboard
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
(1) Introduction
(2) Microfabrication
(3) Integrated Processes
(4) Sensing circuits (Chopper-stabilization, TIA and switched-capacitor
circuit, techniques for reducing sensor offset, noise and charge injection)
(5) Micromachanical Sensors
(6) Bio- and Chemical Sensors
(7) Electrostatic Actuation
(8) Mechanics of Material
(9) Mechanical Vibration
(10) Thermomechanical and Electronics Noises in Sensors
(11) Computer-Aided Design for MEMS
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework + Paper study + Lab (20%)
Final exam (35%)
Project I: accelerometers (25%)
Project II: topic of student's own choice (20%)
Quizzes (extra)
Students are required to choose a research topic as the final project. In the
oral presentation and the written report, please clearly address your motivation
and why the topic is chosen. Students are expected to conduct an extensive
literature survey and realize the design, analysis, fabrication, performance,
and important characteristics of related works in the field.

即可，以整段或顯著地 copy and paste 他⼈文章則是不允許的，必須研讀後以⾃⼰的⽅式寫出⾃
⼰的報告。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程講述有機半導體相關特性、物理、元件、以及應⽤。主要課程⽬的有三 : ⼀是了解相關有機
半導體與相關元件之基本物理特性，理解這些特性之物理來源，以及如何由所量測特性反推結構 /
元件內之物理過程；⼆是理解相關應⽤之⽬前現狀，三是提供相關應⽤所需之相關知識，例如
OLED應⽤中之視感度、 CIE 特性等。主要課程內容包括有機半導體之特性、以及它們在發光元件、
電⼦元件、太陽電池等、及⽣化感測等相關之⽤途。本課程之⽬的希望提供電機系電⼦所等相關背
景同學在有機半導體研究領域的基本知識。本課程將主要強調共軛⾼分⼦相關有機半導體。
修習完本課程後  可以對有機半導體光電元件之基本原理、基本製程、發展現狀以及發
展⽅向等有⼀⼤要的了解。對於⽬前有機顯⽰器、可撓式電⼦元件、有機相關太陽電池、有機感測
器等，可有⼀基本的了解。
修習本課程應先具備有基本半導體元件的基本知識，  以及以及基本量⼦物理 ( ⼀維位能井之能階 )
的概念。共軛 pi 電⼦系統的簡單計算⽅式會於課程中講述。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books) 與參考資料
本課程將主要以講義為主，並輔以相關期刊論文。

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Solar Cells

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程的⽬的在提供學⽣了解太陽電池的基本原理、設計太陽電池最佳化之半定量評估，並對⽬前
新穎太陽電池之發展最⼀簡介。本課程之先修科⽬為固態電⼦元件或者相關半導體元件課程。修過
本課程可對於⽬前太陽電池的現狀、與新穎太陽電池之發展有⼀清楚的了解。本課程預達成三個⽬
標:1.了解各物理參數對於太陽電池元件特性的影響； 2. 了解如何由量測來評估 / 分析影響太陽電
池特性的主要參數，及如何改進； 3. 各種太陽電池的基本了解與未來發展趨勢。
我希望這是⼀個具有研究性質導向的研究所課程，除了習題外，上課同學必須餐與課程做期中與期
末報告，針對欲深入探討的特定課題尋找相關 paper ，對論文內容做出消化，做⼗分⾄⼗五鐘報
告。期中為該課題原理之初步報告，期末則進⼀步報告相關的應⽤或文獻上研究成果。
另外，⼤部分習題都需使⽤⼀些計算軟體，我希望來修課的同學⾄少要能使⽤ ( 或者盡快具備使⽤
能⼒ )Matlab, Mathematica, 或者 Maple 等軟體，或能⾃⾏寫相關計算程式亦可。

無 以課程講義為主

中文名稱  Course Title ：半導體微波元件
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Semiconductor Microwave Devices
任課教師  Instructor ：徐永珍  Hsu, Yung-Jane
上課時間  Time ： F2F3F4 上課教室  Room ：台達 201 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course introduces the properties of the semiconductor devices used in
microwave circuits. Both active devices and passive devices are addressed. The
concept and language used in microwave circuit analysis will be introduced.
The equivalent circuit models of the devices for circuit design will also be
discussed.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
PPT handouts will be provided to the class.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Kai Chang, Microwave Solid-state Circuits and Applications, John Wiley
2. Michael Steer, Microwave and RF Design - A Systems Approach, SciTech
Publishing
3. Inder Bahl and Prakash Bhartia, Microwave Solid State Circuit Design, 2nd
edition, Wiley-Interscience
4. Academic papers and reports
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)

Transmission Lines
Planar Resonators

Smith Chart
Impedance Transformation Techniques
Varactors
Using PIN Diodes as Switches
Three-port Passive Networks
Using 2-terminal Devices in Oscillators and Amps
Microwave Transistors Concept and Circles for Transistor Amplifiers
Microwave Transistors _ MESFET, HEMT, SiGe FETs, SiGe HBT
Noise Models

202002學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
120
中文名稱  Course Title ：程式語⾔
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Programming Languages
任課教師  Instructor ：許榮鈞
上課時間  Time ： M7M8R5R6 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程名稱：程式語⾔（ Programming Languages ）
⼆、授課教師：⼯科系 / 核⼯所  許榮鈞（ rjsheu@mx.nthu.edu.tw ）
三、教學⽅式： 3 學分 ( 每週上課三⼩時 )
四、課程說明：
如何充分利⽤並發揮電腦的功能？你應該了解電腦架構與運作基礎，學習透過數學與邏輯思考設計解
題步驟，再利⽤程式語⾔ ( 控制電腦執⾏的語法 ) 來實現你的想法 ! 這也是本課程的設計⽬的，學習利⽤
程式語⾔來協助你解決問題，特別是⼀些重複性⾼或牽涉複雜計算的⼯作。我們可以利⽤程式語⾔來
控制電腦的運作，達到⾃動化的處理以⼤幅增進⼯作效率。了解電腦⼯作的原理與如何建立演算法 / 解
題⽅案 (Algorithm) 是程式設計最重要的核⼼。本課程主要以 C 語⾔為例介紹程式設計的基本概念，包
括：變數、運算⼦、流程控制、函數、陣列、指標、字串、結構、輸入 / 輸出與檔案處理。上課內容同
時搭配介紹 Python 直譯式程式語⾔，因其簡潔易學特性作為 C 語⾔學習的比較，課堂上所有案例都有 C
與Python 程式碼可供學⽣對照學習。另外，許多⼯程領域的科學計算主要還是以 FORTRAN 語⾔為主，
期末我們也會提及 FORTRAN 與其它語⾔的比較。若有時間也將簡介⼀些進階的資料結構概念，以利
同學未來持續深入程式設計的領域。
課程內容章節如下：
1. Introduction to Computers, the Internet, and the Web
2. Introduction to C Programming
3. Structured Program Development in C
4. C Program Control
5. C Functions
6. C Arrays
7. Python Basics and Data Structures
8. C Pointers
9. C Characters and Strings
10. C Structures and Enumerations
11. C File Processing
12. Fortran, C/C++, and Python for Scientific Computing
五、指定⽤書  (Textbook)
1. P.J. Deitel & H. M Deitel, “C How to Program”, 6th/7th/8th Edition, Prentice Hall (2009/2012/2016)
2. A.B. Downey, “Think Python: How to Think Like a Computer Scientist”, 2nd Edition, O'Reilly Media
(2015)

2. Final (40%) 上機考試
3. Homework (20%)
4. Quiz (+5%)

203001學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 60
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼯程數學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Engineering Mathematics I
任課教師  Instructor ：林明緯
上課時間  Time ： T1T2F1F2 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  503 ／ 90
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
This is a mandatory mathematics course for students of the second year of study in
the ESS department. The topics of this course include:
(1) Ordinary differential equations: 1st order ODEs, 2nd order ODEs, higher order
ODEs, and systems of ODEs.
(2) Special functions and power series method.
(3) Laplace transform.
* 課程預備知識 : 需已修習過微積分
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
D. G. Zill, W. S. Wright, and J. J. Ding, Engineering Mathematics,Metric Edition,
Cengage learning, Taipei, Taiwan (2019)
三、參考書籍 (References)
Michael D. Greenberg, "Advanced Engineering Mathematics" 2nd ed.,
(1998 by Prentice-Hall International, 2006 by Pearson Education)
Zill & Wright, "Advanced Engineering Mathematics", 6th Ed., Jones & Bartlett
(2017)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
3 hours lecture per week 。
上課時間 : 每週⼆及週五上午  8:30-9:50 ( 課程中間不下課休息 )
Office Hours,
Thursday, 17:00 - 18:00 pm
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Part 1. Introduction to Differential Equations
Week 1: Definitions and Terminology and Initial-Value Problems
Part 2. First-Order Differential Equations
Week 2, 3: Separable Equations, Linear Equations, Exact Equations, Solutions by
Substitution
(Bernoulli equation, Riccati equation), and an Introduction to Numerical Method
Part 3. Higher-Order Differential Equations
Week 4, 5: Theory of Linear Equations, Reduction of Order, and Homogeneous Linear
Equations with constant coefficients.
Week 6, 7: Undetermined Coefficients, Variation of Parameters, Cauchy-Euler
Equations, and Nonlinear equation.
Week 8, 9: Linear Models of Initial-Value and Boundary-Value problems, and Solving
System of Linear Equations.
Part 4. Series Solutions of Linear Differential Equations
Week 10, 11: Power Series Solutions and the Method of Frobenius
Week 12: Bessel Functions and Legendre Functions
Part 5. The Laplace Transform
Week 13, 14: Definition of Laplace transform, The Inverse Transform and Transform
of Linear Equations, Translation Theorems, Derivative of Transforms, Transform
Integral
Week 15: Transform of a periodic Function, and System of Linear Differential
Equations.
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Attendance Quiz (10%)
Homeworks (10%)
First Midterm Exam (25%)
Second Midterm Exam (27%)
Final Exam (28%)
科號  Course Number ： 11110ESS
203002學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 60
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼯程數學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Engineering Mathematics I
任課教師  Instructor ：王翔郁
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W1W2 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is a mandatory mathematics course for students in the second year of
ESS department. The topics of this course include:
1) Ordinary Differential Equations: 1st order ODEs, 2nd order ODEs, higher
order ODEs, systems of ODEs
2) Special functions and power series method
3) Laplace Transform
* 課程預備知識 : 需已修習過微積分
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Zill, Wright, and Ding, "Engineering Mathematics", Jones & Bartlett, metric
version
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
3.5 hours lecture per week 。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Week 1: Introduction to Differential Equation, definition of basic
terminology
Week 2,3: Qualitative solution and numerical methods (Chapter 2 and 6)
Week 4-6: Linear ODE (homogeneous, non-homogeneous): Euler's integrating
factor method, Lagrange's variations of parameter method, Separable
equation, exact equation and integrating factors. (Chapter 2)
Week 7-8: Linear ODE of 2nd order or higher, linear independent/dependent,
Wronskian, basis set of solution of DE, existence and uniqueness for
Initial-Value Problem, homogeneous equation with
constant coefficients (characteristic equation, distinct roots, repeated
roots ), harmonic oscillator (free oscillation) (Chapter 3)
Week 9-10: Linear nonhomogeneous equation with constant coefficients (method
of undetermined coefficients, method of inverse operators), Forced harmonic
oscillator, system of linear ODE with constant coefficients, Linear ODE with
variable coefficients (Cauch-Euler equation, Method of reduction of order,
Method of variation of parameters)(Chapter 3)
Week 11-13: Laplace transform, inverse Laplace transform, special functions,
application to the solution of ODE. (Chapter 4)
Week 14-15: power series method, Method of Frobenius, Legendre equation,
Gamma function, Bessel equation, modified Bessel equation (Chapter 5)

Midterm exam I(30~34%)
Final exam (30~33%)
⼩考 &點名  (0~10%)

中文名稱  Course Title ：電路學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electric Circuits
任課教師  Instructor ：吳順吉
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3R4 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is an introductory course in circuit analysis for undergraduate students.
The purpose is to give the students an understanding of various analytical
techniques for describing the behaviors of circuits. Topics to be covered
include Basic Laws, Methods of Analysis, Circuit Theorems, Operational
Amplifiers, Capacitors and Inductors, First/Second-Order Circuit, Steady-State
Sinusoidal Analysis, Frequency Response, and Two-Port Networks.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Introduction to Electric Circuits, Richard C. Dorf and James A. Svoboda, 9th
ed., 2014, John Wiley & Sons.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Fundamentals of Electric Circuits, C. K. Alexander and M. N. O. Sadiku, 5th
ed., 2013, McGraw-HILL.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂板書授課，每周上課  150 分鐘。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Basic Laws,
2. Methods of Analysis,
3. Circuit Theorems,
4. Operational Amplifiers,
5. Capacitors and Inductors,
6. First-Order Circuit,
7. Second-Order Circuit,
8. Steady-State Sinusoidal Analysis,
9.Frequency Response, and
10. Two-Port Networks.
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)- 以上課說明為準
1. Homework 10%
2. Two midterm exams 30% + 30%
3. Final exam 30%
No make-up exam!

223000學分  Credit ： 3⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
120
中文名稱  Course Title ：電⼦學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electronics I
任課教師  Instructor ：巫勇賢
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3F4 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The objective of this course is to develop in the students the ability to
analyze and design electronic circuits, both analog and digital, discrete and
integrated.
The following is the outline of this course:
1. Introduction to the basic concepts of electronics. Signals, their frequency
spectra, and their analog and digital forms are presented. Amplifiers are
introduced as circuit building blocks and their various types and models are
studied.
2. Introduction to operational amplifiers. Their terminal characteristics,
simple
applications, and limitations are presented.
3. Study of PN junction diode terminal characteristics. Its hierarchy of
models
and basic circuit applications are discussed.
4. Operation principle of MOS field-effect transistor (MOSFET). Study of the
device structure and its physical operation are included. In addition, its
applications are demonstrated through some circuit examples.
5. Operation principle of bipolar junction transistor (BJT). Device physics
will be described and circuit models for transistor operation in different
modes will be developed and utilized in the analysis and design of circuit.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Sedra/Smith, "Microelectronic Circuits", Oxfrod, 7/8th Ed.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Neaman,"Electronic Circuit Analysis And Design,"Irwin.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Powerpoint files from the course website.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to electronics: 1 week
2. Operational Amplifier: 3 weeks
3. Diodes and related circuits: 3 weeks.
4. BJT Transisotrs: 4 weeks.
5. MOs Transistors: 5 weeks.
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)

Midterm II 30%
Final: 30%

中文名稱  Course Title ：電磁學⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electromagnetism II
任課教師  Instructor ：柳克強
上課時間  Time ： M5M6R1R2 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  502 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is the part II of the course on introduction of fundamental
electromangetics, both physics and engineering applications. Here we will
continue our discussions on the following topics:
1. Time-varying electromagnetic fields
2. Electromagnetic plane waves
3. Guided electromagnetic waves, waveguides and transmission lines
4. Electromagnetic radiations and antennas
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1. David Griffth, Introduction to Electrodynamics
2. Lecture Notes (can be downloaded from NTHU e-learning system)
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. N. N. Rao, Elements of Engineering Electromagnetics, 6ed.
2. David K. Chang, Field and Wave Electromagnetics, 2nd ed.
3. William H. Hayt, Jr. and John A. Buck, Engineering Electromagnetics, 7th
ed.
4. John D. Kraus and Daniel A. Fleisch, Electromagnetics with Applications,
5th ed.
5. David M. Pozar, Microwave Engineering, 4th ed.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture and discussions
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
0. Review of vector calculus, electrostatics and magnetostatics
1. Electrodynamics (Griffth, Chapter 7)
2. Conservation Laws (Griffth, Chapter 8)
3. Electromagnetic Waves (Griffth, Chapter 9)
4. Potentials and Waves (Griffth, Chapter 10)
5. Radiation (Griffth, Chapter 11)
6. Transmission lines,waveguides & antennas
(David K. Chang, Field and Wave Electromagnetics, 2nd ed.)

240001學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 55
中文名稱  Course Title ：熱⼒學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Thermodynamics
任課教師  Instructor ：林洸銓
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W1W2 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  501 ／ 90
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
Conservation of energy; definitions of heat and work for a macroscopic system;
system states; first law analysis for closed systems; first law control volume
analysis; second law; properties and behavior of pure substances; application
to thermodynamic systems operating in a steady state and transient processes;
typical power producing cycles and refrigerators.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Thermodynamics: An Engineering Approach by Cengel and Boles 9th Ed
● 參考書籍 (References)
Fundamentals of Thermodynamics by Borgnakke and Sonntag, Wiley 10th Ed
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Three hours of lecture (English) per week
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
Introduction and basic concepts (Week #1,2)
Properties of pure substances (Week #3,4)
First law: energy analysis of closed systems (Week #5,6)
Midterm Exam (Week #7)
First law: energy analysis of open systems (Week #8,9)
Second law (Week #10,11)
Midterm Exam (Week #12)
Entropy (Week #13-15)
Refrigeration and Brayton cycles (Week #16,17)
Final Exam (Week #18)
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
Quizzes: 10%
Midterm exam #1: 30%
Midterm exam #2: 30%
Final exam: 30%

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程教授偏微分⽅程的解法及複變函數論，授課內容包含 : Sturm-Liouville problems,
orthogonal eigenfunction expansions, diffusion equations, wave equations, Laplace
equation, Laurent series, residue theorem and applications, conformal mappings 等
等。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Zill/Wright/Ding, Engineering Mathematics, Metric Edition, Cengage, Taipei, Taiwan
(2019)
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Kreyszig, Advanced Engineering Mathematics, Wiley
2. Greenberg, Advanced Engineering Mathematics, Prentice-Hall
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂板書講解
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Part V: Partial Differential Equations
Chap 16 - Boundary-Value Problems in Rectangular Coordinates
Chap 17 - Boundary-Value Problems in Other Coordinate Systems
Chap 18 - Integral Transforms
Part VI Complex Variables
Chap 19 - Complex Numbers and Functions
Chap 20 - Complex Integrals
Chap 21 - Complex Series
Chap 22 - Mapping by Complex Functions
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
ESS 305001 數值分析⼀（ Numerical Analysis I ）
Course Description:
本課授課內容針對具⼯程背景與具有微積分、⼯程數學以及基本程式語⾔基礎的⼤學部⾼年學⽣。
學⽣可經由本課程學習利⽤數值⽅法解決⼯程問題之能⼒同時認識本系多領域整合應⽤的獨特性，
對於未來從事進階研究或是進入職場頗有裨益，是值得⼯程專業的學⽣深入學習的基礎課程。
Instructor:
藍貫哲（ Tel: 35566 ，低碳綠能⼤樓 -615 室， kclan@mx.nthu.edu.tw ）
Prerequisites:
Introduction to Computer Science, Calculus, Computer Languages, Computer
Programing, Engineering Mathematics
Hours/Place:
W34 F34/ ⼯科  506
Syllabus
Chapter 0 Matlab ABC
Chapter 1 Mathematical Preliminaries and Error Analysis
Chapter 2 Solutions of Equations of One Variable
Chapter 3 Interpolation and Polynomial Approximation
Chapter 4 Numerical Integration and Differentiation
Chapter 5 Numerical Solution of Initial-Value Problems
Chapter 11 Numerical Solution of Boundary-Value Problems
Chapter 6 Direct Methods for Solving Linear Systems
Chapter 7 Indirect Methods for Solving Linear Systems
Chapter 8 Approximation Theory
Text Books
J.D. Faires, R.L. Burden, "Numerical Methods," 4th edition, Brooks and Cole
Publishing Company, CA, 2013.
References:
1. M.L. James, G.M. Smith, J.C. Wolford, "Applied Numerical Methods for
Digital Computation," 4th edition, Harper Collins College Publishers, 1993.
2. S.D. Conte, C. De'Boor, "Elementary Numerical Analysis," 3rd edition,
McGraw-Hill Book Company, 1980.
3. C.F. Gerald, P.O. Wheatley, "Applied Numerical Analysis," 5th edition,
Addison-Wesley Publishing Company, 1994.
4. S. Nakamura, "Applied Numerical Methods with Software - An Algorithmic
Approach," Prentice-Hall International, Inc., 1991.
5. B. Bradie, "A Friendly Introduction to Numerical Analysis," Pearson
Education, Inc., 2006.
6. A. Kharab, R.B. Guenther "An Introduction to Numerical Methods, A MATLAB
Approach," 3rd edition, CRC Press, 2012.
7. J.D. Faires, R.L. Burden, "Numerical Analysis," 9th edition, Brooks and
Cole Publishing Company, CA, 2011.

宗旨 : 學習基本數位與記憶體電路 , 介紹輸出級電路、運算放⼤器、濾波器之概念，並瞭解訊號產

中文名稱  Course Title ：儀器與量測
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Instrumentation and Measurements
任課教師  Instructor ：李志浩
蘇育全
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3F4 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  503 ／ 90
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程為偏重應⽤的⼀⾨課，課程中會介紹包含電⼦學、機率與統計、系統動態、
與⼒學及熱傳等各⽅⾯的基本觀念。修課同學若沒有⾜夠的相關基礎，通常就得靠
課後⾃修才能跟上進度，另外若實驗相關經驗不⾜也可能造成理解上的障礙。因此
建議同學們於三、四年級已具備⼀定基礎後再修習本課程，以避免內容太多無法消
化或觀念抽象無法產⽣共鳴等困擾。本課程另提供實驗課程，歡迎修課同學選修。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
J.P. Holman, "Experimental Methods for Engineers", McGraw-Hill
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂講解
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
本課程在前八週將由李志浩老師介紹以下內容
Chap. 1: Introduction
Chap. 2: Basic Concepts
Chap. 3: Analysis of Experimental Data
Chap. 4: Sensing Devices
Chap. 12: Radiation Measurement
Chap. 14 signal process
Chap. 15 Report writing
本課程在後八週將由蘇育全老師介紹以下內容
Chap. 5: Displacement and Area Measurements
Chap. 6: Pressure Measurement
Chap. 7: Flow Measurement
Chap. 8: Temperature Measurement
Chap. 10: Strain Measurement
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
隨堂測驗、作業、期中考、與期末考
分別為 16%, 14%, 35%, 35%

328000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：訊號與系統
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Signals and Systems
任課教師  Instructor ：吳順吉
上課時間  Time ： T7T8R7R8 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  503 ／ 90
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course introduces basic concepts in signals and systems and their
associated mathematical and computational tools. Its purpose is to provide a
common background for subsequent courses in electrical engineering:
communications, control, electronic circuits, filter design, and digital
signal processing. Topics to be covered include Linear Time-Invariant Systems,
Fourier Series Representation of Periodic Signals, The Continuous-Time Fourier
Transform, The Discrete-Time Fourier Transform, Time and Frequency
Characterization of Signals and Systems, Sampling, The Laplace Transform and
The Z-transform.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
A. V. Oppenheim and A. S. Willsky, "Signals and Systems," 2nd ed., Prentice-
Hall, 1997.
三、參考書籍 (References)
K. Gopalan, "Introduction to Signal and System Analysis", Cengage Learning
2009.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂板書授課，每周上課  150 分鐘。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Linear Time-Invariant Systems,
2. Fourier Series Representation of Periodic Signals,
3. The Continuous-Time Fourier Transform,
4. The Discrete-Time Fourier Transform,
5. Time and Frequency Characterization of Signals and Systems,
6. Sampling,
7. The Laplace Transform, and
8. The Z-transform.
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)- 以上課說明為準
1. Homework & Computer Assignments 20%
2. Midterm exam 40%
3. Final exam 40%
No make-up exam!

科號  Course Number ： 11110ESS
351000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：物理冶⾦⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Physical Metallurgy I
任課教師  Instructor ：朱鵬維
上課時間  Time ： M5M6F5F6 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  406 ／ 70
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
This is the first course of a two-semester sequence treating metallurgical
phenomena and their utilization in engineering materials and processes. The
contents in the first semester are mainly focused on the fundamentals of materials
science including (1) crystal structure, (2) defects in crystals, (3) kinetics:
diffusion in substitutional and interstitial solid solutions, (4) thermodynamics:
phase and phase diagrams, and (5) plastic deformation.
● 建議先修課程 (Prerequisite Courses)
Introduction to Materials Science I, Thermodynamics of Materials
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
R. Abbaschian, L. Abbaschian, R.E. Reed-Hill, Physical metallurgy Principles, 4th
Edition, Cengage Learning, 2008
● 參考書籍 (References)
(1) R.E. Smallman, A.H.W. Ngan, Modern Physical metallurgy, 8th Edition,
Butterworth-Heinemann/Elsevier, 2014.
(2) P. Haasen, B.L. Mordike, Physical metallurgy, 3th Edition, Cambridge
University Press, 1996.
(3) D.E. Laughlin, K. Hono (Editors), Physical metallurgy, 5th Edition, Elsevier,
2014.
(4) D.A. Porter, K.E. Easterling, M.Y. Sherif, Phase Transformations in metals and
Alloys, 3rd Edition, CRC Press, 2009.
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures with PowerPoint materials and digital board writing highlight important
concepts and calculation demonstrations.
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
Introduction
Crystal Structure of metals
Defects in Crystals
Diffusion
Thermodynamics and Phase Diagrams
Deformation of metals and Dislocations
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
25% of homework + class activities,
25% of 1st midterm exam,
25% of 2nd midterm exam,
25% of final exam.
● 可連結之網⾴位址  相關網⾴ (Personal Website)
eLearn數位學習平台 (https://elearn.nthu.edu.tw/) including syllabus, lecture notes,
homework problems, etc.

科號  Course Number ： 11110ESS
401100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：輻射安全
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Radiation Safety
任課教師  Instructor ：許榮鈞
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3F4 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  502 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
第⼀部份  輻射安全簡介 (Part 1: Introduction of Radiation Safety)
1. 輻射基本認識 (Basic understanding of radiation)
2. 輻射與物質作⽤ (Radiation interactions with matter)
3. 輻射度量簡介 (Introduction of radiation measurement)
4. 輻射遷移計算簡介 (Introduction of radiation transport)
第⼆部份  輻射防護 (Part 2: Radiation Protection)
1. 輻射劑量單位 (Radiation units)
2. 輻射⽣物效應 (The biological effects of radiation)
3. 天然與⼈造輻射源 (Natural and man-made radiation sources)
4. 輻射防護標準 (Standard of radiation protection)
5. 輻射劑量的計算 (Computations of exposure and dose)
6. 體內劑量估算 (Evaluation of internal dose)
第三部份  輻射屏蔽 (Part 3: Radiation Shielding)
1. 加⾺射線屏蔽 (Gamma-ray shielding)
2. 中⼦輻射屏蔽 (Neutron shielding)
3. 核反應器屏蔽 (Nuclear reactor shielding)
4. X光機屏蔽 (Shielding for X-ray machines)
5. 加速器屏蔽 (Shielding for accelerators)

課程說明
This course is designed for post-sophomore science or engineering majors who wish
to acquire medium-level knowledge in electrochemistry. The topics covered in this
course include:
(1) Introduction to Electrochemistry (1 week)
(2) Behaviors of Electrolytes in Solutions (3 weeks)
(3) Chemical Thermodynamics of Electrochemical Species (2 weeks)
(4) Electrochemical Potential (2 weeks)
(5) Electrochemistry of Electrodes (4 weeks)
(6) Techniques of Electrochemical Analysis (3 weeks)

James Holler and Stanley R. Crouch, Brooks/Cole Thomson Learning, 2004.

2007.

461000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：真空技術
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Vacuum Technology and Surface Analysis
任課教師  Instructor ：林郁洧
上課時間  Time ： RaRbRc 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程⼤綱
⼀、  課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程主要探討真空技術的理論及真空元組件等，內容包括真空技術的基礎理論、各式真空幫
浦的介紹、各類真空元件及材料、真空系統的設計組裝、真空測漏，以及真空度量與檢校。真空技
術是現代科技的基⽯，從⺠⽣相關的食品包裝、眼鏡鍍膜、電視映像管，到⾼科技產業中的光電元
件與半導體製程、尖端的材料分析儀器，甚⾄龐⼤的同步輻射加速器，真空技術都扮演著重要的核
⼼⾓⾊。沒有真空技術就無法享受⾼品質的現代⽣活，也不⾜以從事⾼科技的研究。真空技術的進
步，不僅可精進儀器設備的性能，並能提升各種產業製程效能及產率，進⽽實現許多技術的創新。
因此，真空技術可說是未來科技產業及科學研究發展的重要基礎。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
真空技術與應⽤  --- 基礎篇  (Vacuum Technology & Application)
國家實驗研究院儀器科技研究中⼼出版
⼆、  參考書籍 (References)
[1] Vacuum Technology, L.G. Carpenter, ed. 1983, A Hilger
[2] Vacuum Technology, 2nd, rev. ed. A. Roth 1982, Elserier.
[3] 蘇清森，真空技術，東華書局。
[4] 呂登復，實⽤真空技術，國興出版社。

第四週  氣流與氣導

第六週  氣體的吸附和放出

第八週  真空度量

500000學分  Credit ： 0 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：專題演講
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Colloquium
任課教師  Instructor ：朱鵬維
陳馨怡
上課時間  Time ： W7W8 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1. 計分⽅式：
本學期演講共 12 次，⼼得報告繳交 12 次則於期末可獲得基本成績 A 。
【加分⽅式】每次與講者互動提問加總成績⼀級分，累計最⾼⾄ A+ 。
【⼼得報告繳交】
內容要求：每次⼼得報告⾄少 100 個字以上且與該次演講內容相符。若未達 100 字簡略的⼼得報告或
⼼得內容與該次演講內容不相符則扣總成績⼀級分，並須於助教通知後在截⽌期限內補交⼼得單否則
當週視為缺交⼼得單。
準時繳交⼼得單：最晚需於演講完隔⽇週四中午 12 點前上傳 PDF 電⼦檔⾄ eeclass
遲交⼼得單：
(1) 可遲交時間：演講隔⽇週四中午 12 點後⾄隔週四中午 12 點前，如 10/5 週三演講必須於 10/13 週
四中午 12 點前交⼼得單，否則即視為缺交⼼得單並不再接受該次⼼得單。
(2) 扣分機制：每次遲交將於期末每次扣⼀級分。如此在繳交 12 次⼼得報告⽽期末成績為基本分 A 的
情況下，遲交⾄第 5 次即可讓期末成績低於 B- ，請同學注意。 e. g., 12 reports → A – 4 late
reports → B- + 5 questions → A+
缺交⼼得單：
(1) 超過可遲交時間，即演講完隔週四中午 12 點後仍未繳交⼼得單則視為缺交⼼得單。
(2) 扣分機制：每次扣五級分，如此在期末成績為基本分 A 的情況下，缺交 1 次即可讓期末成績低於
B-，若無因提問加分將於期末不及格，請同學注意。
【不及格情況】
⼀次只能交⼀份⼼得報告，不可代交。如發現代寫⼼得情形，雙⽅學期成績零分，並送學務處以考試
作弊處置，沒有補救⽅法。
2. 請假規則  ( 注意本學期無替代演講 ) ：
每個專題演講皆會錄影並應需求在 eeclass 開放給同學觀看。
無法參加專題演講的同學可在提交假單後，使⽤ eeclass 平台於⼀週內觀看演講並於該演講後隔週四
中午 12點前繳交⼼得單⾄ eeclass ，若超過期限未繳交⼼得單則視為缺交⼼得單，每次扣五級分。
如2/23週三演講必須於 3/3 週四中午 12 點前交⼼得單否則視為缺交
請假單請⾃⾏在 eeclass 下載，填寫後給指導老師簽名確認⽽後寄交助教。分為：
(1) 單次「專題演講請假單」
適⽤事假、病假等。每次請假申請須於該次演講結束後隔⽇週四中午 12 點前提交，否則視為遲交⼼
得單每次扣期末成績⼀級分。單⼀學期⾄多可申請三次請假，之後若無正當理由每個超過次數扣期末
成績⼀級分。
(2)「⻑期無法實際出席專題演講申請單」
適⽤於預期單⼀學期將超過三次以上無法實際出席專題演講之學⽣，僅適⽤在職⽣、駐校外單位執⾏
研究之學⽣、因疫情無法入境之學⽣等。校內學⽣不適⽤。此申請單須於開學後兩周內提出申請，逾
期不受理。

如有其他問題請聯絡助教：  ( 請依實際選課系所來連絡所屬助教 )
4. 以上內容若與實際上課公告不同，請以上課第⼀週公告之規則為依據。
1. Grading Guide ：
There are 12 colloquium talks this semester. You need to submit 12 qualified
reports to get a basic final grade of A.
【 Bonus points 】 can be acquired through your on-site questions or critical
comments to the speaker → asking one question to the speaker deserves one bonus
grad point and can be accumulated up to A+.
【The submission of report form 】
Requirement: Each report needs to contain more than 100 words and be closely
related to the talk. A short or sketchy (<100 words) report or the content in
the reports is irrelevant to the talk, is regarded as a disqualified one, and
will result in a deduction in the final grade by one grade point. The student
should also resubmit a qualified report after receiving the notice from the TA
before the deadline; otherwise, the report is considered as a missed one that
causes a loss of five grade points at the end of the semester.
On-time submission: After the talk, the associated report form should be
uploaded to the eeclass platform (PDF file only) before noon (12 pm) of the next
day (Thursday). Any report submitted after the deadline is considered as a late
report.
Late report submission:
(1) Time for late submission: Starts from 12 pm of the next day after the talk
to the noon (12 pm) of next Thursday. e.g., for a talk on 10/5 (Wed), the report
submitted before the noon (12 pm) on 10/13 (next Thursday) is considered as a
late report.
(2) Deduction of grades: Late submission of the report causes a deduction in the
final grade by one grade point and so on. Therefore, (assuming you are in the
case of submitting 12 qualified reports and got the basic final grade of A),
five late report submissions can result in a final grade below B- without helps
from the bonus points. Please be aware to submit on time. e. g., 12 reports → A
– 4 late reports → B- + 5 questions → A+
Missed report:
(1) Report after the period of time defined for late submission will not be
accepted, e. g., for a talk on 10/5 (Wed), a missed report is defined as the
absence of report after the noon (12 pm) on 10/18 (next Thursday)
(2) Deduction of grades: a missing report causes the deduction by five grade
points in the final grade and so on. Therefore, one missed report can result in
a final grade below B- without helps from the bonus points.
【Fail condition 】
Each person can only submit one report at a time, and you cannot help other
students to submit their reports. If we found out there are cases of plagiarism,
the semester scores of both parties would be zero, and they will be sent to the
school affairs office to deal with the act of cheating in the exam, and there is
no remedy.
2. Leave Rules (Please be aware there will be no alternative talk report this
semester):
Every colloquium talk will be recorded and will be available on eeclass when
requested. Students who cannot attend the colloquium can submit their leave
form, then watch the video on eeclass, and submit the report form (PDF file
only) to eeclass before noon (12 pm) of next Thursday after the talk.
e.g., for a talk on 10/5 (Wed), the report with a leave request should be
submitted before the noon (12 pm) on 10/18; otherwise, a missed report causes
the deduction by five grade points in the final grade and so on. The leave form
can be downloaded from the eeclass platform. Please fill in the info and get it
signed by your advisor before you email it to the TA. There are two types of
leave forms:
(1) For single use: Leave Form
Applicable to personal leave, sick leave, etc. Each leave application form
should be handed to TA before noon (12 pm) of next day after the talk, or else
the report will be considered as a late submission. A maximum of three leave
applications are allowed for one semester. If your applications exceeded the
allowed chances without appropriate reason, each exceeded leave application will
result in a deduction in the final grade by one grade point.
(2) For long term use: Leave Form
Applicable to students who can’t attend the colloquium more than three times.
E.g. on-job students, students who are doing research outside the university for
a long-term period, students who cannot enter the country due to the pandemic,
etc. Students staying at NTHU cannot apply. This application form must be
submitted within two weeks after the start of the semester. Late application
will not be accepted.
3. Contact TAs for questions
If you have any other questions, please contact the TAs. (Please refer to your
enrolled department for the corresponding TAs.)
4. If there is any disagreement between this syllabus and the class
announcements, pleases refer to the rules announced in the class first week of
the semester.

520000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：微電⼦⼯程
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Silicon Processing Technology for Microelectronics
任課教師  Instructor ：吳永俊
上課時間  Time ： R7R8R9 上課教室  Room ：⼯科 NE69 ／ 240
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程⼤綱  Detailed Course Syllabus
● 課程說明 (Silicon Processing Technology for Microelectronics)
11009 微電⼦⼯程 (ULSI Technology) 課程
The advances in ultra-large-scale-integration (ULSI) technology based on
aggressive scaling of CMOS devices provide enormous opportunities for high-
performance communication, and computing systems. This course is designed to
provide the current status of advanced ULSI technology process and CMOS
integration projecting a road map for nanoelectronic devices for the current and
next generation. 先修課程 : 無
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1.教師⾃編的微電⼦⼯程  (ULSI Technology 500 pages) (Handout of related ULSI
Nanoelectronic devices SCI journal and conference papers)
2. Hong Xiao( 蕭宏 ) 原著「 Introduction to Semiconductor Manufacturing Technology 」
(第⼆版 )
● 參考書籍 (References)
1. 相關半導體製程與整合之教科書
2. IEEE, IEDM, VLSI, SCI journal papers
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
投影片教學  90%, 版書  10%
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
Chapter1: Unit Process Module ( 半導體單元製程 )
Chapter2: ULSI Process Integration ( 半導體製程整合 )
Chapter3: Semiconductor Device Material Analysis ( 半導體元件材料分析 )
Chapter4: ULSI Advanced Process ( 半導體先進製程 )
Chapter5: FinFET Process Integration for N14 ( 鰭式電晶體製程 )
Chapter6: N5/N3/N2/N1 technology research and development (N5 到 N1 製程研究與發展 )
● 可連結之網⾴位址  相關網⾴ (Personal Website)
1. https://semiwiki.com/ 2. http://www.imec.org/ 3. https://semiengineering.com/
4. https://www.eetimes.com/

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The purpose of this course is to introduce students the fundamentals of
plasma laboratory techniques including plasma sources and plasma diagnostic
techniques, as well as general experimental design methods.
The lecture will be given in English first and then a brief
explanation in Chinese.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
lecture notes
三、參考書籍 (References)
References:
1. A. Wang, Introduction to Experimental Plasma Physics
2. Varian Associates, Basic Vacuum Practice
3. J. R. Roth, Industrial Plasma Engineering
4. M. Libermann and A. Lichtenberg, Principles of Plasma Discharges and
Materials Processing
5. O. Auciello and D. Flamm, Plasma Diagnostics
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
lectures 50 %
experiments (demostration by senior graduate students) 50 %
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
A. Vacuum system:
Vacuum pumps and gauges.
High vacuum systems: Diffusion pump system & Turbo-molecular pump
system.
B. Plasma Sources
1. Inductively-coupled plasmas (ICP)
2. Electron Cyclotron Resonance (ECR) Microwave Plasmas
3. DC Plasmas*
C. Plasma Diagnostics
1. Langmuir Probe
2. Microwave Interferometer
3. Spectroscopy of Plasma Induced Optical Emissions
4. Computer Data Acquisition and Control
D. Experiment Design Methods

549000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：計算熱流學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Computational Fluid Dynamics and Heat Transfer
任課教師  Instructor ：林洸銓
上課時間  Time ： T8T9Ta 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  506 ／ 70
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
This course introduces students to foundational as well as working knowledge
of Computational Fluid Dynamics and Heat Transfer. Topics include: finite
difference operators; Taylor and Fourier analysis; 1D & 2D boundary value
problems; simple iterative methods; advanced iterative methods; time
integration methods; matrix stability analysis and modified PDEs; non-linear
hyperbolic PDEs; upwind schemes for conservation laws; finite volume schemes.
The hands-on experience is offered in aspects of real-world problems that are
solved computationally by ANSYS FLUENT.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Lecture notes will be offered.
● 參考書籍 (References)
An Introduction to Computational Fluid Dynamics: The Finite Volume Method, 2nd
edition, by H. Versteeg and W. Malalasekera, Pearson, 2007.
An Introduction to ANSYS Fluent 2020, John Matsson, SDC, 2020
An Introduction to Computational Fluid Mechanics by Example, by Sedat Biringen
and Chuen-Yen Chow, John Wiley & Sons, Inc, 2011
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures offered in English
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
The weekly breakdown of lectures is based on the topics described in the

科號  Course Number ： 11110ESS
553500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：材料動⼒學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Kinetic Process of Materials
任課教師  Instructor ：朱鵬維
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3R4 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  406 ／ 70
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
This course covers the kinetics aspect of materials science and engineering,
emphasizing the fundamentals and mathematical descriptions of diffusion and
chemical reactions. The topics to be covered are theories and mechanisms of
diffusion, diffusion calculations, ionic diffusion, basics of chemical reactions,
and related applications.
● 建議先修課程 (Prerequisite Courses)
Thermodynamics of Materials, Physical metallurgy, Engineering Mathematics
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
H.I. Yoo, Lectures on Kinetic Processes in Materials, Springer, 2020.
● 參考書籍 (References)
(1) R.W. Balluffi, S.M. Allen, W.C. Carter, Kinetics of Materials, Wiley, 2005.
(2) P. Shewmon, Diffusion in Solids, 2/E, TMS, 2016.
(3) M.E. Glicksman, Diffusion in Solids: Field Theory, Solid-State Principles,
and Applications, Wiley, 1999.
(4) J. Crank, The Mathematics of Diffusion, Clarendon Press, 1979.
(5) C. Vallance, An Introduction to Chemical Kinetics, Morgan & Claypool
Publishers, 2017.
(6) P. Atkins et al., Physical Chemistry, 11/E, Oxford University Press, 2018
(7) Y.M. Chiang, D.P. Birnie, W.D. Kingery, Physical Ceramics: Principles for
Ceramic Science and Engineering, Wiley, 1997.
(8) D.J. Young, High Temperature Oxidation and Corrosion of metals, Elsevier,
2016.
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures with digital board writing and PowerPoint materials highlight important
concepts and calculation demonstrations.
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
Introduction
Theories and Mechanisms of Diffusion
Diffusion Equations and Solutions
Some More Discussions about Diffusion
Chemical Reaction Kinetics
Adsorption and Evaporation
Diffusion in Ionic Solids
Oxidation
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
30% of homework + class activities,
35% of midterm exam,
35% of final exam.

eLearn數位學習平台 (https://elearn.nthu.edu.tw/) including syllabus, lecture notes,
homework problems, etc.

科號  Course Number ： 11110ESS
556500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 36
中文名稱  Course Title ：電⼦薄膜科技
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electronic Thin Film
任課教師  Instructor ：歐陽汎怡
上課時間  Time ： W2W3W4 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  406 ／ 70
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1. 課程說明 (Course Description):
It is well known that thin films are widely used in the electronic industry.
Due to the trend
on miniaturization of electronic devices, nanosclae electronic devices are
needed and the
technology and reliability of thin films have recently attracted increasing
attentions. This
course will focuses on the science and process of thin films, and reliability
science for thin
film application in the electronic industry. The topics will cover:
- Fundamental topic in thin-film process: deposition, surface energy and atomic
diffusion
- Application of diffusion equations (Fick’s first law and Fick’s second law)
- Theoretical and practical understanding of electronic thin-film reliability:
metallurgical
reaction, electromigration, thermomigration and stressmigration
2.指定⽤書 (Text Books):
*"Electronic Thin-Film Reliability", King-Ning Tu, Cambridge University
Press, 2010,
ISBN 978-0-521- 51613-6.
*“Solder Joint Technology, Materials, properties and reliability", King-
Ning Tu, Springer,
2007, ISBN 10:0-387-38890-7.
3. 參考書籍 (References)
* “Flip chip technologies”John H. Lau, McGraw-Hill, 1996.
*“Electronic Packaging, Design, Materials, Process, and Reliability” John
Lau, C.P.
Wong, John L. Prince, and Wataru Nakayama, McGraw-Hill.
*“Principles of Electronic Packaging”Donald P. Seraphim, Ronald C. Lasky,
Che-yu Li,
McGraw-Hill, 1993.
* Fundamentals of Microsystems Packaging, R.R. Tummala, McGrawHill,2001
* 微電⼦材料與製程，陳⼒俊主編中國材料科學學會  2000
* “Microelectronics packaging handbook” R.R. Tummala and E.J. Rymaszewski,
Van
Nostrand Reinhold, 1989.
4. 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method):
* 3 hours of lecture per week
* Oral presentation
* One Midterm, One Final
5.教學進度 (Syllabus)
* Introduction: Thin Film Applications to Microelectronic Technology
* Thin film deposition and Surface energy
* Surface energy & Diffusion in solid
* Elastic stress & strain in thin film
* Introduction of reliability, FCT Reliability: metallurgical Reaction
* Interconnect Reliability: Electromigration in interconnect
* FCT reliability: Electromigration, thermomigration, stressmigration in FC
solder
* Packaging technology
6. 成績考核 (Evaluation)
* Homework+class activity 25 %
* Midterm I: 30%
* Final: 25%
* Presentation 20%

564400學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：同步加速器 X 光吸收光譜分析應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Applications of Synchrotron X-ray Absorption Spectroscopy
任課教師  Instructor ：陳燦耀
上課時間  Time ： T7T8T9 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  504 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1. Chapter 1 - Introduction to X-ray absorption spectroscopy (XAS): history
and
applications
2. Chapter 2 - Principles of XAS theory
3. Chapter 3 - X-ray absorption near edge spectroscopy (XANES) and Extended X-
ray
absorption fine structure (EXAFS)
4. Chapter 4 - Experiment techniques and limitations of XAS: Optics, sample
environments, and data acquisition systems for XAS
5. Chapter 5 - XAS practical: structure characterizations from bulk to
molecules
(crystal defects (thin films) → atomic structure arrangements (heterogeneous
catalyst) → surface adsorption (soil science) → metallic protein complexes
(biomedicine and soft matters physics) → metallic polymer conjugates → atomic
thermal vibration)
6. Chapter 6 - XAS practical: geometric consideration on the XSA data
interpretations (case study by Pt/AC), case study on the bimetallic
nanoparticles
7. Midterm exam
8. Chapter 7 - XAS data interpretation and analysis (ifeffit program: Athena
package for data normalization, calibration, chemical composition analysis,
preliminary analysis)
9. XAS practical topics: environment science
10. XAS practical topics: heterogeneous catalysts
11. Chapter 7 - XAS on chemical composition analysis, coordination environment
12. XAS practical topics: biomedical
13. Group presentations (literature reviews and experiment designs)
科號  Course Number ： 11110ESS
581000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 20
中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼等微系統製造與實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced Micro System Fabrication and Lab
任課教師  Instructor ：曾繁根
上課時間  Time ： F6F7F8 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  504 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Using micro fabrication technology to fabricate micro sensors, micro
structures, and micro actuators. This course teaches 12 fundamental and
advance MEMS fabrication techniques, including cleaning procedure, lithography,
thermal oxidation, lift off process, e-beam evaporation, reactive ion etching,
wet chemical etching, micro electroplating, thick PR lithography, anodic
bonding, wafer dicing, wire bonding, and standard process parameter testing
techniques. The final goal will use those techniques to fabricate 12 different
micro structures, sensors, and actuators, including accelerometer, humidity
sensor, temperature sensor, micro mirror, micro cantilever, thermal actuator,
flow sensor, micro channel, micro mixer, micro filter, and bulk etching testing
structures, etc. Students will be broken into 4 groups, and each group (~5
students) must finish the fabrication process of 3 wafers. This course is offered in English.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1.Advance Micro System Fabrication and Experiment, Lecture notes and Lab handouts by Fan-
Gang
Tseng, Fall, 2016.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1.Fundamentals of Microfabrication, Marc Madou, CRC Press, 1997.
2.Introduction to Microelectronic Fabrication, Richard C. Jaeger, Addison-Wesley Publishing
Company,
Inc, 1998.
3.Micromachined Transducers’ source book, Gregory T.A. Kovacs, McGraw-Hill, 1998.
4.AIP Handbook of Modern Sensros, Jacob Fraden, American Institute of Phusics, 1993.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture time: T7T8T9, Place: ESS 504
Lab time: TBD (each week will need 3-8 hours for experiment), place: NESS 702/704/707/709)

4. Lec3: Wet chemical etching (Lab report #1)
Lab 3: Silicon dioxide wet etching (BOE) and PR strip (Pirhana)
5. Lec4:Lithography II
Lab 4:Back side wet etching, PR patterning for lift-off process (AZ 5214, negative, mask #2, outline
and course name) (Lab report #2)
6. Lec5: Vacuum System
*Lab 5: Vacuum, E-beam deposition of Ti/Ni (300/1500 A)
7. Lec6: Physical Vapor Deposition
Lab 6: Lift-off process, and PR striping (organic stripper)
8. Lec7: Dry etching technique. (Lab report #3)
Lab 7: Lithography patterning Ti/Ni by wet etching (AZ 5214, positive, mask #2, device)
9. Midterm
10. Lec8: Polymer MEMS
*Lab 8: Thick PR process for plating (SJR 5740, mask #3, mask for plating)

micro structures testing

科號  Course Number ： 11110ESS
582200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：分⼦動⼒學模擬
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Molecular Dynamics Simulations
任課教師  Instructor ：蕭百沂
上課時間  Time ： R7R8R9 上課教室  Room ：⼯科  504 ／ 50
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
In this course, I will teach molecular dynamics simulations to students.
Capabilities of programming and running programs are prerequisites for this
course. Knowledge about numerical analysis, classical mechanics and
statistical mechanics in very helpful in understanding the techniques and
methods of molecular dynamics simulations.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
None
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Rapaport, the Art of Molecular Dynamics Simulation, 2nd edition,
Cambridge 2004
2. Haile, Molecular Dynamics Simulation -- elementary methods, Wiley 1992
3. Allen and Tildesley, Computer Simulation of Liquids, Oxford 1987
4. Frenkel and Smit, Understanding Molecular Simulation -- from Algorithms
to Applications, 2nd edition, Academic Press 2002
5. Tuckerman, Statistical mechanics: Theory and molecular simulation, Oxford
2010
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
three lecture hours per week.
Note: this is not an "experimental" or "practical" course.
There will be no class to teach students how to do programming or running
simulations. However, programming and running simulations will be a part of
student's home works.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1.Introduction (week 1)
2.Basic molecular dynamics (week 2)
3.Integration methods: Euler’s method, Runge-Kutta method, predictor-
corrector method, Verlet algorithm; Interaction computations: neighbor-list
method, cell subdivision (week 3 & 4)
4. Alternative ensembles: NVT, NPT (week 5 & 6)
5.Statistical properties: RDF, heat capacity, chemical potential, entropy
(week 7)
6.Dynamical properties: transport coefficients, dynamic structure (week 8)
7.Long-range interactions: Ewald summation (week 9 & 10)
8.Geometric constraints: Shake and Rattle algorithms (week 11)
9.Rigid molecules: quaternions (week 12)
10.Many-body interactions: three-body forces, EAM (week 13)
11.Multiple time step scheme: rRESPA (week 14&15)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework 30%
Midterm exam 35%
Final exam(or presentation) 35%
七、可連結之網⾴位址
For more information, please refer to
http://mx.nthu.edu.tw/~pyhsiao/teaching.htm

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明
This course is offered for junior/senior undergraduate students and graduate
students with physical science or engineering backgrounds who previously have no
extensive exposure to biochemistry. This course consists of lecture series and
hands-on experiments. The topics covered in this course include:
(1) Basic Organic Chemistry
(2) Biomolecules
(3) Modern Bioanalytical Techniques
參考書籍
1. General, Organic and Biochemistry, Katherine J. Denniston, Joseph J. Topping
and Robert L. Caret, McGraw Hill, 2004.
2. Bioanalytical Chemistry, Susan R. Mikkelsen and Eduardo Cortón, John Wiley &
Sons, 2004.
教學⽅式
Lectures and hands-on experiments (Protein Adsorption on Modified Silica
Surfaces
with Various Self-Assembled Organosilane Coatings, Fabrication of Protein
Arrays,
Fluorescence Immunoassays Using Protein Biochips)
教學進度
Basic Organic Chemistry (4 weeks)
Biomolecules (2 weeks)
Bioconjugate Chemistry (1 week)
Modern Bioanalytical Chemistry (4 weeks)
Experiments (4 weeks)
成績考核
1. 2 Mid-Term Exams (25% each)
2. Homework, Paper Presentation and Lab Reports (25%)
3. Final Exam (25%)

698000學分  Credit ： 0 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：論文研究
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Thesis
任課教師  Instructor ：指導教授
上課時間  Time ： 上課教室  Room ：
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 :
在指導教授之指導下，就各別選定之題⽬進⾏有系統研究，期獲得在該領域知識與技術上之成果。
⼆ 、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)

三、教學進度 :(Syllabus)
由教授指定
四、成績考核 (Evaluation) 由論文素質，研究態度決定

科號  Course Number ： 11110FL 102811學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 25
中文名稱  Course Title ：進階英文：聽講
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced English: Listening and Speaking
任課教師  Instructor ：周寶齡
上課時間  Time ： F3F4 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C522 ／ 35
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Advanced English: Listening and Speaking
objective: to enhance students' listening and speaking ability through
intensive communicative activities based on handouts and videos
from different sources.
Teaching material: handouts, videos, etc. No book is needed.
Teaching methods: The whole-language approach will be implemented in this
course divided into three parts:
Part I.: (General conversation class):International news report, followed by
videos for a variety of interactive activities, including group
discussion/public debate
Part II: Modified International Toastmaster Program
Part III: Authentic language use: Innovative Product Marketing /Jobs Hunting/
Flea Market (prepare students for a real-life competition )
Since language is learned through interactions, students are highly expected to
actively participate in a variety of activities to enhance speaking confidence as
well as competence.
Evaluation:
Class participation /performance 60%
Midterm 15%
Final 15%
E-mail feedback 10%

This course aims to prepare students' ability of comprehension, appreciation and
critical thinking on literature works. Students will achieve the goal through
study of canonical works, presentation or research of historical and cultural
backgrounds, class discussion and writing, and most likely their preparation for
exams. Online Platform: https://eeclass.nthu.edu.tw/

Grading: 學期成績計算⽅式
◆ 平時考成績  （ quizzes, presentations, and assignments ）： 40.0 %
◆ 期中考成績： 30.0 %
◆ 期末考成績： 30.0 %
Textbook: The Norton Introduction to Literature ed. by Kelly J. Mays (Shorter 13th
edition)
Classroom Activities
Exams: There will be a Midterm exam and a Final exam. Both are in-class tests. The
exams may include multiple-choice questions, short answer questions and essay
questions, though not necessarily limited to and/or include all of these types.
The exams may cover the texts, the topics we discuss, and so on. I recommend you
take notes during class discussions.
Quizzes: We will have quizzes to cover the reading materials throughout the whole
semester. Our quizzes will cover a few questions concerning to basic information
of the plot.
Disclaimer:
The schedule and class activities are subject to change at the discretion of the
instructor, who may adjust them according to various factors as required to
optimize teaching. Changes may include: how students’ receive class materials;
change of lecture models (i.e. from face-to-face to long distance or vice versa
due to school or national requirements), etc. Students may or may not be offered
information for specific dates and/or content of in-class activities. There is
always a likelihood of "pop quizzes" or other activities occurring during any
given class, of which everything covered in the class is a fair game. Students who
are absent for whatever reasons are NOT immune to any responsibilities as normal
registered course takers. In other words, they should actively seek information or
opportunities for bonus points for in-class activities that take place when
absent, regardless of whether a class is officially "excused" or not. Performance
of tasks are necessary, regarding of status of being "excused" or not, and must be
made up through bonus points. It is wise to always double check with the assistant
for any ambiguities in terms of class rules and to verify one's make-up bonus
points.
Classroom Conduct
1. Attendance/ Absence:
- Two points from your Final Grade will be deducted per absence.
- You can be absent up to two times without having points deducted. This
includes all excuses (sick leave, personal leave, official leave, etc.)
- Tardiness and Roll Call:
1) You are expected to attend all class meetings ON time. If you’re 15 min.
late, then you’re counted as “absent” for the class period. During the class
periods, if I notice some students are missing, I might take roll again. Those who
are absent will be counted “absent” on that day.
2) Roll call—this can happen anytime during the class periods. If you happen
to be temporarily absent (i.e. in the bathroom), it is YOUR responsibility to
inform the assistant on the SAME day. Otherwise you are counted as absent.
2. Exams and Assignments:
- All assignments are due on the dates announced and/or indicated on the
syllabus. Assignments are collected at the beginning of each class (in a face-to-
face setting). No late assignments will be accepted unless you have made
arrangements with the instructor prior to the due date. Please provide your full
Chinese name and student number in order to secure your grades.
- No makeup of any class activities, including writing exercises, quizzes,
presentations (if any), etc. In the case of long-distance learning, you are
responsible to make sure your internet works fine. No exceptions will be made for
late in-class assignments.
- All makeup Exams (Midterm and Final Exam only) will be lowered by 20% and
will be substantially more difficult than the exam given in class.
- Being tardy for exams (more than 20 min. late) will result in a thirty
percent deduction from the exam grade. Students who arrive one hour late are not
allowed to take the exam.
3. Participation and Bonus Points:
- Students will be called on to answer questions, and this participation of
class discussion is regarded highly. Your participation grade in this class
includes work done in class, your attendance, completed homework, a respectful
attitude to the class, and so on. Just being present in class does NOT
automatically guarantee a high participation grade.
- Students who participated the class by voluntarily expressing their
thoughts can earn 1 bonus point each time. Bonus points may be accumulated to
reach a maximum of 5 points. Please email to notify the assistant for this part of
grade on the SAME day you articulate your thoughts in class. Overdue notification
will not count.
- You may earn bonus points by attending literary and theatrical
events/forums. Each attendance will earn you 3 points, and you may accumulate at
most 6 bonus points through this means. To get the points, you will need to show
the ticket stub (if not applicable, a signature from the organizers/moderators on
the brochure/flyer) stapled onto a 250-words summary of that event.
- You may also earn bonus points by presenting poems/ fictions in the
anthology that are NOT covered in our reading list. In your presentation, you are
to analyze the work of your choice and articulate them without any visual aid.
Each presentation will earn you (up to) 3 points (depend on your performance), and
you may have at most 2 presentations. Please contact our assistant, by providing
works you want to present, for us to set up your presentations. You should apply
your presentations no later than week 13.
4. Classroom Civility: All students are expected to turn off their electronic
devices (i.e. cell phone). Please show respect to the class at all times. Any
disruptive behavior, such as chatting, or playing music, will not be tolerated. If
you do not agree with something, it is your right to RESPECTFULLY bring that to
the attention of the class in a polite manner. Suggestions are always welcome. Any
behavior that disturbs the class will cause a grade deduction (such as talking to
your fellow classmates, talking on or playing with cell phones, and so on). Five
points of a student's final grade will be deducted each time the instructor's
warning is ignored.

初級⽇語
1. 教學⽬標：培養學⽣具備⽇語的基礎溝通與表達能⼒。
2. 教學進度：視學習狀況與學校⾏事曆適時調整進度。上學期進度為⽇語發⾳、簡單會話與《⼤家的
⽇本語初
級 I 改訂版》 1-5 課。下學期為第 6-12 課。
3. 課程說明：本課程主要以⽇語零基礎學⽣為學習對象。
(1) 上學期是學習⽇語發⾳與⽇語平假名 ; 片假名的書寫⽅式，並學習《⼤家的⽇本語  初級 Ⅰ 》的會話與
名詞、
動詞基礎句型等。以期運
⽤在「⾃我介紹」、「購物點餐」、「介紹時間地點事物」等簡單溝通能⼒。
(2) 利⽤書籍或網路視聽教材，輔以平時作業來培養寫作與閱讀能⼒。課程中適時加入相關句型的⽇語
會話、
⽇語歌曲或新聞⽇文，以期有效應⽤本學期的學習內容。
4. 成績考核：期中考（ 30% ）、期末考（ 30% ）、⼩考（ 10% ）、⾃我介紹影片介紹（ 10% ）、作業
（10%）、
出席（ 10% ）【防疫期間將採遠距同步與非同步線上教學。筆試改為書⾯報告】
5. 備註：請慎重選課不⿎勵⼆退。詳細上課⽇期與考試時間，將於第⼀週公布。
6. 線上連結：上課以實體為主。因應新冠疫情，必要時將改為同步遠距上課（網路連
結:https://meet.google.com/akt-tdqp-uif ）請隨時留意清⼤ eeclass 通知。
注意事項：
(1) 本課程共有 18 週。
(2) 除了特殊狀況，恕不開放加簽或⼆退。
(3) 旁聽者請在開課前寫信詢問。
(4) 若是無法在校務系統選課，請在開課前來信詢問。

(8) 請假須來信報告或⼝頭報告，並填寫請假單。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
初級⽇語：
1. 教學⽬標：培養學⽣具備⽇語的基礎溝通與表達能⼒。
2. 教學進度：視學習狀況與學校⾏事曆適時調整進度。上學期進度為⽇語發⾳、簡單會話與《⼤家的
⽇本語初
級 I 改訂版》 1-5 課。下學期為第 6-12 課。
3. 課程說明：本課程主要以⽇語零基礎學⽣為學習對象。
(1) 上學期是學習⽇語發⾳與⽇語平假名 ; 片假名的書寫⽅式，並學習《⼤家的⽇本語  初級 Ⅰ 》的會話與
名詞、
動詞基礎句型等。以期運
⽤在「⾃我介紹」、「購物點餐」、「介紹時間地點事物」等簡單溝通能⼒。
(2) 利⽤書籍或網路視聽教材，輔以平時作業來培養寫作與閱讀能⼒。課程中適時加入相關句型的⽇語
會話、
⽇語歌曲或新聞⽇文，以期有效應⽤本學期的學習內容。
4. 成績考核：期中考（ 30% ）、期末考（ 30% ）、⼩考（ 10% ）、⾃我介紹影片介紹（ 10% ）、作業
（10%）、
出席（ 10% ）【防疫期間將採遠距同步與非同步線上教學。筆試改為書⾯報告】
5. 備註：請慎重選課不⿎勵⼆退。詳細上課⽇期與考試時間，將於第⼀週公布。
6. 線上連結：上課以實體為主。因應新冠疫情，必要時將改為同步遠距上課（網路連
結:https://meet.google.com/yku-cbgx-frp ）請隨時留意清⼤ eeclass 通知。
注意事項：
(1) 本課程共有 18 週。
(2) 除了特殊狀況，恕不開放加簽或⼆退。
(3) 旁聽者請在開課前寫信詢問。
(4) 若是無法在校務系統選課，請在開課前來信詢問。
(5) 部分專有名詞與內容將以中文介紹。
(6) 考試或報告有指定⽇期，如有更動將於 2 週前告知。
(7) 原訂筆試測驗或⼝頭發表可能因疫情⽽改為線上教學、報告。
(8) 請假須來信報告或⼝頭報告，並填寫請假單。

A 課程說明  & 教學進度
1 　50⾳介紹與學習遠景
　⽇語特質概說
　（課程規劃＋⽇劇報告＋分數配置）等之說明
*⾯試⽇商別踩雷 ---- ⽇本⾯試官的落坑題庫
2 　平假名 ( 前半 ) 記憶法
　清⾳ +濁⾳ + 半濁⾳ + 拗⾳
　促⾳ +⻑⾳ + 寒暄⽤語 ( 前半 )
⽇文歌 :桃⼦的⼀天
3 　平假名 ( 後半 ) 記憶法　　　　　　　
　寒暄⽤語 ( 後半 )
*既愛⼜恨 ---- ⽇本⼈的漢字情結
*⽇本孩童的七五三節
4 　聽⼒遊戲 + ⽇文歌 : 淚光閃閃
　 *⽇本國名與⽇⼈姓⽒源由
*阿多仔來⽇本的不適症
5 　片假名 ( 前半 ) 記憶法 + 片假名卡通
　L1 句型 ( 肯定 + 否定 + 問句 )+ 文法練習 + 會話練習
名詞女友相遇動詞男友的助詞定情戒
　 *鉛筆⿊筆的超愛⽤⺠族
*⽇本的辦公室文化
6 　L1 初次⾒⾯寒暄⽤語　
　數字 +數量
*禁⽌騎鹿上學 ” 的奈良校規
*敬禮不握⼿的⽇本⼈
7 　片假名 ( 後半 ) 記憶法 + 片假名卡通　　　　
　 L1 (句型 + 例句 ) 代換練習 + 聽譯練習
放⼤鏡功能的某助詞
*不懂⽇本⽤筷禁忌 ---- 相親準槓⿔
8　 L2 這是什麼 ( ⽣詞 )
　句型 (這那說法 )+ 文法練習
　⽇文歌 : 五⽉天擁抱 ( ⽇文版 )
*⽇本夫妻的離婚公式
9 　L2 會話練習 + ( 句型 + 例句 ) 代換練習 + 聽譯練習　　　　　　　　
*⽇本女友的備鑰
*賣不掉的耶誕蛋糕 ---- 有苦難⾔的⽇本熟女
10　  L3 我買這請給我這　　　　　　　　
句型 (這裡那裏說法 )+ 文法練習 + 會話練習
⾃助遊⽇購物句型
*⽇本孩童的七五三節
11 L3 (句型 + 例句 ) 代換練習 + 聽譯練習 + 會話練習
⽇文歌 :紅⾊麝香 ( 豌豆 ) 花
*禮多⼈不怪 ---- ⽇本⼈的道謝哲學
12 L4 貴處到幾點呢

*說的比唱的好聽的 ” 京都腔 ”v.s 菜市場叫賣的 ” ⼤版腔 ”
13 聽⼒遊戲 + ⽇文歌 : 愛你 ( 三浦版本 * 含⽇文 RAP)
N+V⽅程式
*⽇本夫妻的離婚公式
14 L4 (句型 + 例句 ) 代換練習 + 聽譯練習
*⽇式約會的時間習慣
*⽇本⼈的陽傘情結
15 L5 這巴⼠開往甲⼦園嗎
　　　句型 ( 來去動詞 + ⽇期⽤法 )+ 文法練習  + 會話練習　
*瓜蒂的迷思看⽇本⼈的商業誠信

17 聽譯練習 + ⽇語重⾳判讀　　　　
　 團體⽇劇配⾳加分活動 ( 下 )
*太郎變次郎的悲情時空
18 聽譯遊戲＋⽇本情歌＋成績結算
B 指定⽤書  & 參考書籍
1 教科書  : ⼤家的⽇本語 " 改訂版 "( 初級 1) / ⼤新書局印⾏
(所有考試皆考⾳檔  ⾳檔須學⽣⾃備 )
2 參考書  : ⼤家的⽇本語 ( 初級 1.2) / 文法解說 . 課文中譯 . 問題解答 / ⼤新書局印⾏
C 教學⽅式
1 開胃⼩菜 : 開場皆以 " 聽⼒ " ⼩考⽅式驗收前周之教學成果
2 主食  : 以圖解及放映投影片⽅式講析文法句型，並強調⼝⽿學習，訓練學員與 CD
⽇語同部對嘴及逐步對譯 , 並加重刺激其⼤腦之中⽇文轉換反應。
3 配菜  : 課中依教材內容及插圖 , 穿插講述⽇本⽣活文化。並出⽰實物圖片 , 放送 10
分鐘與課文相關之影片或⽇劇 , 讓學員進入情境學習。
4 附湯  : 課間介紹並播放⽇劇影片與⽇本情歌 , 部份歌曲亦安排卡拉ＯＫ教學。
D 成績考核：
期中考  + 期末考  + 每週⼩考  + ⽇劇報告  + 其他 ( 參賽 or ⽇劇配⾳ or 唱⽇文歌等 )
= 0 ＋  0 ＋  約 69 ＋  25 + 約 5 ＝  約 99 分
1 每週課前有⼩考 ( 每次佔總成績約 4.2 分 ) 所有⼩考皆為課本例句ＣＤ之聽譯測驗
2 本課程無期中期末考  但⼩考量多  平⽇需耗費相當時間熟讀⽅能應考  負荷繁重  無暇應付
之學⽣切勿修選
3 開課 4週後須繳交⼀份⽇劇報告  為⾃尋半年內上演之⽇劇  撰寫每集約 30 字中文的劇情描
述（全篇約 300 字）全學期僅此⼀份報告　
4 學期中抽點數次  未請假缺席者每回扣學總成績 7 分以上  無法固定到課者請勿修習

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course keywords:
初級⽇語 Beginning Japanese, 聽⼒ listening, 會話 conversation, 閱讀 reading, 寫作 writing
初級⽇語
1. 教學⽬標：培養學⽣具備⽇語的基礎溝通與表達能⼒。
2. 教學進度：視學習狀況與學校⾏事曆適時調整進度。上學期進度為⽇語發⾳、簡單會話與《⼤家的
⽇本語初
級 I 改訂版》 1-5 課。下學期為第 6-12 課。
3. 課程說明：本課程主要以⽇語零基礎學⽣為學習對象。
(1) 上學期是學習⽇語發⾳與⽇語平假名 ; 片假名的書寫⽅式，並學習《⼤家的⽇本語  初級 Ⅰ 》的會話與
名詞、
動詞基礎句型等。以期運
⽤在「⾃我介紹」、「購物點餐」、「介紹時間地點事物」等簡單溝通能⼒。
(2) 利⽤書籍或網路視聽教材，輔以平時作業來培養寫作與閱讀能⼒。課程中適時加入相關句型的⽇語
會話、
⽇語歌曲或新聞⽇文，以期有效應⽤本學期的學習內容。
4. 成績考核：期中考（ 30% ）、期末考（ 30% ）、⼩考（ 10% ）、⾃我介紹影片介紹（ 10% ）、作業
（10%）、
出席（ 10% ）
【防疫期間將採遠距同步與非同步線上教學。筆試改為書⾯報告】
5. 備註：請慎重選課不⿎勵⼆退。詳細上課⽇期與考試時間，將於第⼀週公布。
6. 線上連結：上課以實體為主。因應新冠疫情，必要時將改為同步遠距上課（網路連
結:https://meet.google.com/vwu-ymff-imm ）請隨時留意清⼤ eeclass 通知。
注意事項：
(1) 本課程共有 18 週。
(2) 除了特殊狀況，恕不開放加簽或⼆退。
(3) 旁聽者請在開課前寫信詢問。
(4) 若是無法在校務系統選課，請在開課前來信詢問。
(5) 部分專有名詞與內容將以中文介紹。
(6) 考試或報告有指定⽇期，如有更動將於 2 週前告知。
(7) 原訂筆試測驗或⼝頭發表可能因疫情⽽改為線上教學、報告。
(8) 請假須來信報告或⼝頭報告，並填寫請假單。

科號  Course Number ： 11110FL 201301學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 30
中文名稱  Course Title ：初級⻄班牙語⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Beginning Spanish I
任課教師  Instructor ：張雅鈴
上課時間  Time ： M7M8M9 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 B303 ／ 20
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
本課程主要⽬的在於培養 A1 入⾨級⻄語能⼒。透過課堂講解與互動練習，引導學⽣學習基礎發
⾳、詞彙和語法規則，以及發展個⼈⽣活領域基本溝通技能，例如聽懂簡短對話或訊息、會介紹
⾃⼰與他⼈、讀懂留⾔或廣告內容、填寫個⼈資料表等。另外，配合教學內容介紹⻄語國家相關
文化，藉此增進語⾔理解與運⽤能⼒。
⼆、指定⽤書
Sánchez Lobato, Jesús y García Fernández, Nieves. Nuevo español 2000 -nivel
elemental. Libro del alumno. Madrid: SGEL, 2007. (ISBN: 9788497783002)
三、參考書籍
- Castro, Francisca. Uso de la gramática española Elemental. Madrid: Edelsa,
2011.
- Baralo, Marta. Vocabulario: elemental A1-A2. Madrid: Anaya, 2013.
- Borobio, Virgilio. Ele actual A1. Libro del alumno. Madrid: Ediciones SM,
2012.
四、教學⽅式
課堂講解、師⽣互動、分組練習、朗讀文本、使⽤多媒體輔助教材等
五、教學進度
週次 /⽇期 / 課程主題和內容

《ser》 (現在式動詞變化及其⽤法 )- 敬稱的使⽤ - 本句型 ( 肯定句否定句疑問句 )- 數字 (1-20)

第3週  基礎發⾳、 Lección 1

⽰代名詞 - 疑問詞 - 數字 (50-60)

科號  Course Number ： 11110FL 201303學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 42
中文名稱  Course Title ：初級⻄班牙語⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Beginning Spanish I
任課教師  Instructor ：張雅鈴
上課時間  Time ： WnW5W6 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C507 ／ 35
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明
本課程主要⽬的在於培養 A1 入⾨級⻄語能⼒。透過課堂講解與互動練習，引導學⽣學習基礎發
⾳、詞彙和語法規則，以及發展個⼈⽣活領域基本溝通技能，例如聽懂簡短對話或訊息、會介紹
⾃⼰與他⼈、讀懂留⾔或廣告內容、填寫個⼈資料表等。另外，配合教學內容介紹⻄語國家相關
文化，藉此增進語⾔理解與運⽤能⼒。
⼆、指定⽤書
Sánchez Lobato, Jesús y García Fernández, Nieves. Nuevo español 2000 -nivel
elemental. Libro del alumno. Madrid: SGEL, 2007. (ISBN: 9788497783002)
三、參考書籍
- Castro, Francisca. Uso de la gramática española Elemental. Madrid: Edelsa,
2011.
- Baralo, Marta. Vocabulario: elemental A1-A2. Madrid: Anaya, 2013.
- Borobio, Virgilio. Ele actual A1. Libro del alumno. Madrid: Ediciones SM,
2012.
四、教學⽅式
課堂講解、師⽣互動、分組練習、朗讀文本、使⽤多媒體輔助教材等
五、教學進度
週次 /⽇期 / 課程主題和內容
第1週  基礎發⾳、 Lección 1 問候與道別 - ⾃我介紹 - 介紹他⼈ - 職業∥⼈稱代詞主格 - 《 ser 》
(現在式動詞變化及其⽤法 )- 敬稱的使⽤ - 本句型 ( 肯定句否定句疑問句 )- 數字 (1-20)
第2週  基礎發⾳、 Lección 1
第3週  教師節 ( 停課⼀天 )
第4週  Lección 2 國籍 - 描述⼈的外貌及個性∥國籍形容詞 - 數字 (21-50)- 形容詞的性與數
第5週  Lección 2
第6週  Lección 3 描述城市及其建築物∥冠詞的性與數 - 名詞的性與數 - 地⽅副詞 - 指⽰形容詞 - 指
⽰代名詞 - 疑問詞 - 數字 (50-60)
第7週  Lección 3
第8週  Lección 3
第9週  期中考  ( 基礎發⾳ + Lecciones 1-3)
第10週  全校運動⼤會 ( 停課⼀天 )
第11週  Lección 4 問候 - 表達狀況或狀態 - ⼈事物定位 - 描述房間和家具∥《 estar 》 ( 動詞變化
及其⽤法 )- 地點前置詞 - 《 ser 》和《 estar 》的區別 - 數字 (60-100)
第12週  Lección 4
第13週  Lección 5 介紹住家環境 - 顏⾊ - 家⼈親屬∥無⼈稱句《 hay 》 - 《 hay 》和《 está/n 》的
區別 -所有格形容詞 - 《 tener 》 ( 動詞變化及其⽤法 )
第14週  Lección 5
第15週  Lección 6 時間與⽇期 - 年齡 - 詢價 - 天氣∥《 hacer 》 ( 動詞變化及其⽤法 )- 《 mucho 》和
《muy》的區別 - 數字 (1-1.000.000.000)
第16週  Lección 6
第17週  Lección 6
第18週  期末考  (Lecciones 4-6)

⼀、課程說明
本課程從⻄班牙語發⾳開始，運⽤中文、台語及英文來學習⻄班牙語發⾳。
藉由短、中、⻑句練習單字、學習文法、練習閱讀，進⽽訓練⼝說。
應⽤網路資源 ( 電視、廣告、短劇、 youtube 短片、卡通 …etc) 、故事繪本、情境對話、主題寫作來練習
聽說讀寫。

2016.

3)

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
清華⼤學核⼼能⼒ :
1. 溝通表達與語文能⼒
2. 經典作品分析能⼒
3. 問題發掘與研究能⼒（含⽤科學⽅法進⾏語⾔分析）
4. 創作與創新能⼒
5. 全球視野與多元文化認知能⼒
教育⽬標 :
1.Help students acquire advanced communicative competence in English and
basic
proficiency in a second foreign language
2.Develop students' analytical ability and independent thinking through
training
in literature, linguistics, and applied linguistics
3.Broaden students' global perspectives.
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程宗旨為學習法文基本的語⾔字彙及文法，並穿插法國的歌曲及影片，藉由
課堂的分組討論增進溝通技巧及分享彼此的看法，並了解中法文化之間的相異性。

四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
採⽤互動的⽅式，除了老師講解內容之外，也請同學上台表達，偶爾看影片，
以瞭解法國⼈的⽣活⽅式與習慣。希望透過情境化的學習融入教材中。
